trans-unit.source: Use the knife configure subcommand to create the client.rb and config.rb files so that they can be distributed to workstations and nodes.
Use the knife configure subcommand to create the knife.rb and client.rb files so that they can be distributed to workstations and nodes.
trans-unit.target: Use el subcomando de knife configure para crear los archivos knife.rb y client.rb para que puedan distribuirse a estaciones de trabajo y nodos.

trans-unit.source: Use the knife cookbook site subcommand to interact with cookbooks that are available in the Chef Supermarket. A user account is required for any community actions that write data to this site. The following arguments do not require a user account: download, search, install, and list.
Use the knife cookbook subcommand to interact with cookbooks that are located on the Chef Infra Server or the local chef-repo.
Use the knife data bag subcommand to manage arbitrary stores of globally available JSON data.

Use the knife delete subcommand to delete an object from a Chef Infra Server. This subcommand works similar to knife cookbook delete, knife data bag delete, knife environment delete, knife node delete, and knife role delete, but with a single verb (and a single action).

Use the knife delete subcommand to delete an object from a Chef server. This subcommand works similar to knife cookbook delete, knife data bag delete, knife environment delete, knife node delete, and knife role delete, but with a single verb (and a single action).
trans-unit.target: Use el subcomando de knife delete para eliminar un objeto de un servidor Chef. Este subcomando funciona de forma similar a knife cookbook delete , knife data bag delete , knife environment delete , knife node delete y knife role delete , pero con un solo verbo (y una sola acción).

trans-unit.source: Use the knife deps subcommand to identify dependencies for a node, role, or cookbook.
trans-unit.target: Use el subcomando knife deps para identificar dependencias para un nodo, rol o libro de cocina.

trans-unit.source: Use the knife diff subcommand to compare the differences between files and directories on the Chef Infra Server and in the chef-repo. For example, to compare files on the Chef Infra Server prior to uploading or downloading files using the knife download and knife upload subcommands, or to ensure that certain files in multiple production environments are the same. This subcommand is similar to the git diff command that can be used to diff what is in the chef-repo with what is synced to a git repository.

Use the knife diff subcommand to compare the differences between files and directories on the Chef server and in the chef-repo. For example, to compare files on the Chef server prior to an uploading or downloading files using the knife download and knife upload subcommands, or to ensure that certain files in multiple production environments are the same. This subcommand is similar to the git diff command that can be used to diff what is in the chef-repo with what is synced to a git repository.
trans-unit.target: Use el subcomando knife diff para comparar las diferencias entre archivos y directorios en el servidor Chef y en el repositorio chef. Por ejemplo, para comparar archivos en el servidor de Chef antes de cargar o descargar archivos utilizando los subcomandos de knife download y knife upload , o para asegurarse de que ciertos archivos en múltiples entornos de producción sean iguales. Este subcomando es similar al comando git diff que se puede usar para diferenciar lo que está en el repositorio de chef con lo que se sincroniza con un repositorio git.

trans-unit.source: Use the knife download subcommand to download roles, cookbooks, environments, nodes, and data bags from the Chef Infra Server to the current working directory. It can be used to back up data on the Chef Infra Server, inspect the state of one or more files, or to extract out-of-process changes users may have made to files on the Chef Infra Server, such as if a user made a change that bypassed version source control. This subcommand is often used in conjunction with knife diff, which can be used to see exactly what changes will be downloaded, and then knife upload, which does the opposite of knife download.

Use the knife download subcommand to download roles, cookbooks, environments, nodes, and data bags from the Chef server to the current working directory. It can be used to back up data on the Chef server, inspect the state of one or more files, or to extract out-of-process changes users may have made to files on the Chef server, such as if a user made a change that bypassed version source control. This subcommand is often used in conjunction with knife diff, which can be used to see exactly what changes will be downloaded, and then knife upload, which does the opposite of knife download.
trans-unit.target: Use el subcomando de knife download para descargar roles, libros de cocina, entornos, nodos y bolsas de datos del servidor Chef al directorio de trabajo actual. Se puede utilizar para hacer una copia de seguridad de los datos en el servidor de Chef, inspeccionar el estado de uno o más archivos, o para extraer cambios fuera de proceso que los usuarios pueden haber realizado en los archivos en el servidor de Chef, como si un usuario realizara un cambio que omitió el control de fuente de la versión. Este subcomando a menudo se usa junto con knife diff , que se puede usar para ver exactamente qué cambios se descargarán, y luego knife upload , que hace lo contrario de la knife download del cuchillo .

trans-unit.source: Use the knife edit subcommand to edit objects on the Chef Infra Server. This subcommand works similar to knife cookbook edit, knife data bag edit, knife environment edit, knife node edit, and knife role edit, but with a single verb (and a single action).

Use the knife edit subcommand to edit objects on the Chef server. This subcommand works similar to knife cookbook edit, knife data bag edit, knife environment edit, knife node edit, and knife role edit, but with a single verb (and a single action).
trans-unit.target: Use el subcomando knife edit para editar objetos en el servidor Chef. Este subcomando funciona de forma similar a knife cookbook edit , knife data bag edit , knife environment edit , knife node edit , y knife role edit , pero con un solo verbo (y una sola acción).

trans-unit.source: Use the knife environment subcommand to manage environments within a single organization on the Chef Infra Server.
Use the knife exec subcommand to add a job to the whitelist. For example:

Use the knife exec subcommand to execute Ruby scripts in the context of a fully configured Chef Infra Client. Use this subcommand to run scripts that will only access Chef Infra Server one time (or otherwise very infrequently) or any time that an operation does not warrant full usage of the knife subcommand library.
Use the knife exec subcommand to move nodes between environments, such as from a “dev” to a “production” environment. For example:

Use the knife list subcommand to view a list of objects on the Chef Infra Server. This subcommand works similar to knife cookbook list, knife data bag list, knife environment list, knife node list, and knife role list, but with a single verb (and a single action).

Use the knife list subcommand to view a list of objects on the Chef server. This subcommand works similar to knife cookbook list, knife data bag list, knife environment list, knife node list, and knife role list, but with a single verb (and a single action).
trans-unit.target: Use el subcomando de knife list para ver una lista de objetos en el servidor Chef. Este subcomando funciona de forma similar a knife cookbook list , knife data bag list , knife environment list , knife node list , y la knife role list , pero con un solo verbo (y una sola acción).

trans-unit.source: Use the knife node subcommand to manage the nodes that exist on a Chef Infra Server.
Use the knife raw subcommand to send a REST request to an endpoint in the Chef Infra Server API.
Use the knife raw subcommand to send a REST request to an endpoint in the Chef server API.
trans-unit.target: Use el subcomando knife raw para enviar una solicitud REST a un punto final en la API del servidor Chef.

trans-unit.source: Use the knife recipe list subcommand to view all of the recipes that are on a Chef Infra Server. A regular expression can be used to limit the results to recipes that match a specific pattern. The regular expression must be within quotes and not be surrounded by forward slashes (/).

Use the knife recipe list subcommand to view all of the recipes that are on a Chef server. A regular expression can be used to limit the results to recipes that match a specific pattern. The regular expression must be within quotes and not be surrounded by forward slashes (/).
trans-unit.target: Use el subcomando de la knife recipe list para ver todas las recetas que se encuentran en un servidor Chef. Se puede usar una expresión regular para limitar los resultados a recetas que coinciden con un patrón específico. La expresión regular debe estar entre comillas y no estar rodeada por barras diagonales (/).

trans-unit.source: Use the knife role subcommand to manage the roles that are associated with one or more nodes on a Chef Infra Server.
Use the knife search subcommand to run a search query for information that is indexed on a Chef Infra Server.
Use the knife search subcommand to run a search query for information that is indexed on a Chef server.
trans-unit.target: Use el subcomando de knife search para ejecutar una consulta de búsqueda de información que está indexada en un servidor Chef.

trans-unit.source: Use the knife serve subcommand to run a persistent chef-zero against the local chef-repo. (chef-zero is a lightweight Chef Infra Server that runs in-memory on the local machine.) This is the same as running the Chef Infra Client executable with the --local-mode option. The chef_repo_path is located automatically and the Chef Infra Server will bind to the first available port between 8889 and 9999. knife serve will print the URL for the local Chef Infra Server, so that it may be added to the config.rb file.

Use the knife serve subcommand to run a persistent chef-zero against the local chef-repo. (chef-zero is a lightweight Chef server that runs in-memory on the local machine.) This is the same as running the chef-client executable with the --local-mode option. The chef_repo_path is located automatically and the Chef server will bind to the first available port between 8889 and 9999. knife serve will print the URL for the local Chef server, so that it may be added to the knife.rb file.
trans-unit.target: Use el subcomando de knife serve para ejecutar un chef-zero persistente contra el repositorio de chef local. (chef-zero es un servidor Chef ligero que se ejecuta en memoria en la máquina local). Esto es lo mismo que ejecutar el ejecutable chef-cliente con la opción --local-mode . El chef_repo_path se encuentra automáticamente y el servidor de Chef se unirá al primer puerto disponible entre 8889 y 9999 . knife serve imprimirá la URL para el servidor Chef local, de modo que pueda agregarse al archivo knife.rb.

trans-unit.source: Use the knife show subcommand to view the details of one (or more) objects on the Chef Infra Server. This subcommand works similar to knife cookbook show, knife data bag show, knife environment show, knife node show, and knife role show, but with a single verb (and a single action).

Use the knife show subcommand to view the details of one (or more) objects on the Chef server. This subcommand works similar to knife cookbook show, knife data bag show, knife environment show, knife node show, and knife role show, but with a single verb (and a single action).
trans-unit.target: Utilice el subcomando knife show para ver los detalles de uno (o más) objetos en el servidor Chef. Este subcomando funciona de forma similar a knife cookbook show , knife data bag show , knife environment show , knife node show y knife role show , pero con un solo verbo (y una sola acción).

trans-unit.source: Use the knife ssh subcommand to invoke SSH commands (in parallel) on a subset of nodes within an organization, based on the results of a search query made to the Chef Infra Server.
Use the knife ssh subcommand to invoke SSH commands (in parallel) on a subset of nodes within an organization, based on the results of a search query made to the Chef Infra Server.
Use the knife ssh subcommand to invoke SSH commands (in parallel) on a subset of nodes within an organization, based on the results of a search query made to the Chef server.
trans-unit.target: Utilice el subcomando knife ssh para invocar comandos SSH (en paralelo) en un subconjunto de nodos dentro de una organización, en función de los resultados de una consulta de búsqueda realizada en el servidor Chef.

trans-unit.source: Use the knife ssl check subcommand to verify the SSL configuration for the Chef Infra Server or a location specified by a URL or URI. Invalid certificates will not be used by OpenSSL.
Use the knife ssl check subcommand to verify the SSL configuration for the Chef server or a location specified by a URL or URI. Invalid certificates will not be used by OpenSSL.
trans-unit.target: Utilice el subcomando de knife ssl check para verificar la configuración SSL para el servidor Chef o una ubicación especificada por una URL o URI. OpenSSL no utilizará los certificados no válidos.

trans-unit.source: Use the knife ssl fetch subcommand to copy SSL certificates from an HTTPS server to the trusted_certs_dir directory that is used by knife and Chef Infra Client to store trusted SSL certificates. When these certificates match the hostname of the remote server, running knife ssl fetch is the only step required to verify a remote server that is accessed by either knife or Chef Infra Client.

Use the knife ssl fetch subcommand to copy SSL certificates from an HTTPS server to the trusted_certs_dir directory that is used by knife and the chef-client to store trusted SSL certificates. When these certificates match the hostname of the remote server, running knife ssl fetch is the only step required to verify a remote server that is accessed by either knife or the chef-client.
trans-unit.target: Utilice el subcomando de knife ssl fetch para copiar certificados SSL de un servidor HTTPS al directorio trusted_certs_dir que utiliza cuchillo y el chef-cliente para almacenar certificados SSL confiables. Cuando estos certificados coinciden con el nombre de host del servidor remoto, la ejecución de knife ssl fetch es el único paso requerido para verificar un servidor remoto al que acceden cuchillo o el chef-cliente.

trans-unit.source: Use the knife ssl fetch subcommand to pull the SSL certificate down from the Chef Infra Server:
Use the knife ssl fetch subcommand to pull the SSL certificate down from the Chef server:
trans-unit.target: Use el subcomando knife ssl fetch para extraer el certificado SSL del servidor Chef:

trans-unit.source: Use the knife status subcommand to display a brief summary of the nodes on a Chef Infra Server, including the time of the most recent successful Chef Infra Client run.
Use the knife status subcommand to display a brief summary of the nodes on a Chef server, including the time of the most recent successful chef-client run.
trans-unit.target: Use el subcomando de knife status para mostrar un breve resumen de los nodos en un servidor Chef, incluida la hora de la ejecución exitosa más reciente de chef-cliente.

trans-unit.source: Use the knife supermarket command to upload your cookbook to the Supermarket:

Use the knife supermarket subcommand to interact with cookbooks that are available in the Chef Supermarket. A user account is required for any community actions that write data to this site. The following arguments do not require a user account: download, search, install, and list.
Use the knife tag subcommand to apply tags to nodes on a Chef Infra Server.
Use the knife upload subcommand to upload data to the Chef Infra Server from the current working directory in the chef-repo. The following types of data may be uploaded with this subcommand:
Use the knife upload subcommand to upload data to the Chef server from the current working directory in the chef-repo. The following types of data may be uploaded with this subcommand:
trans-unit.target: Use el subcomando de knife upload para cargar datos al servidor de Chef desde el directorio de trabajo actual en el repositorio de chef. Los siguientes tipos de datos se pueden cargar con este subcomando:

trans-unit.source: Use the knife user subcommand to manage the list of users and their associated RSA public key-pairs.
Use the knife xargs subcommand to take patterns from standard input, download as JSON, run a command against the downloaded JSON, and then upload any changes.
trans-unit.target: Use el subcomando knife xargs para tomar patrones de la entrada estándar, descargue como JSON, ejecute un comando contra el JSON descargado y luego cargue cualquier cambio.

trans-unit.source: Use the launchd_service Chef InSpec audit resource to test a service using Launchd.

Use the limits_conf Chef InSpec audit resource to test configuration settings in the /etc/security/limits.conf file. The limits.conf defines limits for processes (by user and/or group names) and helps ensure that the system running those processes remains stable. Each process may be assigned a hard or soft limit.
Use the lint.rb recipe to run linting and other static analysis tools against a project’s source code.
Use the list-client-keys subcommand to list client keys.
trans-unit.target: Use el subcomando list-client-keys para enumerar las claves del cliente.

trans-unit.source: Use the list-user-keys subcommand to list client keys.
trans-unit.target: Use el subcomando list-user-keys para enumerar las claves del cliente.

trans-unit.source: Use the list argument to list all of the environments that are currently available on the Chef Infra Server.
Use the list argument to list all of the environments that are currently available on the Chef server.
trans-unit.target: Utilice la list a de argumentos para listar todos los ambientes que se encuentran actualmente disponibles en el servidor Chef.

trans-unit.source: Use the list argument to list all of the tags that have been applied to a node.
trans-unit.target: Utilice la list a de argumento para una lista de todas las etiquetas que se han aplicado a un nodo.

trans-unit.source: Use the list argument to view a list of cookbooks that are currently available at https://supermarket.chef.io/cookbooks.
trans-unit.target: Use el argumento de la list a para ver una lista de libros de cocina que están actualmente disponibles en https://supermarket.chef.io/cookbooks .

Use the list argument to view a list of cookbooks that are currently available at the Chef Supermarket.
Use the list argument to view a list of cookbooks that are currently available on the Chef Infra Server. The list will contain only the most recent version for each cookbook by default.
Use the list argument to view a list of cookbooks that are currently available on the Chef server. The list will contain only the most recent version for each cookbook by default.

Use the list argument to view a list of data bags that are currently available on the Chef server.

trans-unit.source: Use the list argument to view a list of registered API client.

trans-unit.source: Use the list argument to view a list of registered users.

Use the list argument to view a list of roles that are currently available on the Chef server.

trans-unit.source: Use the list argument to view all of the nodes that exist on a Chef Infra Server.
Use the list argument to view all of the nodes that exist on a Chef server.
trans-unit.target: Use el argumento de list a para ver todos los nodos que existen en un servidor Chef.

trans-unit.source: Use the list subcommand to view the list of instances. Instances are based on the list of platforms in the kitchen.yml file. Test Kitchen will auto-name instances by combining a suite name with a platform name. For example, if a suite is named default and a platform is named ubuntu-18.04, then the instance would be default-ubuntu-1804. This ensures that Test Kitchen instances have safe DNS and hostname records.
Use the listener create argument to create a WinRM listener on the Microsoft Windows platform.

trans-unit.source: Use the load_current_value method to load the specified property values from the node, and then use those values when the resource is converged. This method may take a block argument.
trans-unit.target: Use el método load_current_value para cargar los valores de propiedad especificados desde el nodo y luego use esos valores cuando el recurso esté convergido. Este método puede tomar un argumento de bloque.

trans-unit.source: Use the local subcommand to run Delivery phase or stage on your local Chef Workstation installation, based on settings in the project.toml file located in the project’s .delivery directory.
Use the lockfile setting in the client.rb file to specify non-default locations for the lock file. (The default location is typically platform-dependent and is recommended.)
trans-unit.target: Use la configuración de archivo de lockfile en el archivo client.rb para especificar ubicaciones no predeterminadas para el archivo de bloqueo. (La ubicación predeterminada generalmente depende de la plataforma y se recomienda).

trans-unit.source: Use the login subcommand to log in to a single instance. Instances are based on the list of platforms and suites in the kitchen.yml file. After logging in successfully, the instance can be interacted with just like any other virtual machine, including adding or removing packages, starting or stopping services, and so on. It’s a sandbox. Make any change necessary to help improve the coverage for cookbook testing.

Use the login_defs Chef InSpec audit resource to test configuration settings in the /etc/login.defs file. The logins.defs file defines site-specific configuration for the shadow password suite on Linux and Unix platforms, such as password expiration ranges, minimum/maximum values for automatic selection of user and group identifiers, or the method with which passwords are encrypted.
Use the metadata from file argument to load the metadata for a cookbook from a file.
trans-unit.target: Utilice el argumento metadata from file para cargar los metadatos de un libro de cocina desde un archivo.

trans-unit.source: Use the metadata argument to generate the metadata for one or more cookbooks.
trans-unit.target: Use el argumento de metadata para generar los metadatos para uno o más libros de cocina.

trans-unit.source: Use the mount Chef InSpec audit resource to test the mount points on FreeBSD and Linux systems.
Use the mssql_session Chef InSpec audit resource to test SQL commands run against a Microsoft SQL database.
Use the mysql_conf Chef InSpec audit resource to test the contents of the configuration file for MySQL, typically located at /etc/mysql/my.cnf or /etc/my.cnf.
Use the mysql_session Chef InSpec audit resource to test SQL commands run against a MySQL database.
Use the nginx Chef InSpec audit resource to test the fields and validity of nginx.
Use the nginx_conf Chef InSpec resource to test configuration data for the NGINX server located at /etc/nginx/nginx.conf on Linux and Unix platforms.
Use the node status argument to identify nodes that Chef Push Jobs may interact with. Each node is always in one of the following states:
Use the node['delivery']['workspace_path'] attribute to get the path to the global workspace.
Use the node_batch_size setting to change the number of sets of node data sent in each individual batch to your endpoint. The default value is 50 nodes

Use the nodes/bulk-create endpoint to add multiple nodes with the same set of tags and credentials. Specifying a name_prefix for the nodes in question results in a node name of prefix-host. Specified tags will be added to each node. The endpoint takes an array of node objects, allowing users to add as many nodes as needed.
Use the npm Chef InSpec audit resource to test if a global NPM package is installed. NPM is the the package manager for Node.js packages, such as Bower and StatsD.
Use the ntp_conf Chef InSpec audit resource to test the synchronization settings defined in the ntp.conf file. This file is typically located at /etc/ntp.conf.

trans-unit.source: Use the oneget Chef InSpec audit resource to test if the named package and/or package version is installed on the system. This resource uses Oneget, which is part of the Windows Management Framework 5.0 and Windows 10 <https://github.com/OneGet/oneget>__. This resource uses the Get-Package cmdlet to return all of the package names in the Oneget repository.
Use the oracledb_session Chef InSpec audit resource to test SQL commands run against a Oracle database.
Use the org-create, org-delete, org-list, org-show, org-user-add and org-user-remove commands to manage organizations.
trans-unit.target: Use los comandos org-create , org-delete , org-list , org-show , org-user-add y org-user-remove para administrar organizaciones.

trans-unit.source: Use the os Chef InSpec audit resource to test the platform on which the system is running.
Use the os_env Chef InSpec audit resource to test the environment variables for the platform on which the system is running.

Use the owner and right properties and avoid the group and mode properties whenever possible. The group and mode properties are not true Microsoft Windows concepts and are provided more for backward compatibility than for best practice.
trans-unit.target: Utilice el owner y las propiedades right y evite las propiedades de group y mode siempre que sea posible. Las propiedades de group y mode no son conceptos verdaderos de Microsoft Windows y se proporcionan más por compatibilidad con versiones anteriores que por mejores prácticas.

trans-unit.source: Use the package Chef InSpec audit resource to test if the named package and/or package version is installed on the system.
Use the packages Chef InSpec audit resource to test the properties of multiple packages on the system.
Use the parse_config Chef InSpec audit resource to test arbitrary configuration files.

Use the parse_config_file Chef InSpec audit resource to test arbitrary configuration files. It works in the same way as parse_config. Instead of using a command output, this resource works with files.

Use the passwd Chef InSpec audit resource to test the contents of /etc/passwd, which contains the following information for users that may log into the system and/or as users that own running processes. The format for /etc/passwd includes:
Use the pip Chef InSpec audit resource to test packages that are installed using the Python PIP installer.

Use the platform? method to ensure that certain actions are run for specific platform. The platform? method will return true if one of the listed parameters matches the node['platform'] attribute that is detected by Ohai during every Chef Infra Client run.

Use the platform? method to ensure that certain actions are run for specific platform. The platform? method will return true if one of the listed parameters matches the node['platform'] attribute that is detected by Ohai during every chef-client run.
trans-unit.target: Utiliza la platform? método para garantizar que ciertas acciones se ejecuten para una plataforma específica. La platform? El método devolverá verdadero si uno de los parámetros enumerados coincide con el atributo de node['platform'] que Ohai detecta durante cada ejecución chef-cliente.

trans-unit.source: Use the platform_family? method to ensure that certain actions are run for specific platform family. The platform_family? method will return true if one of the listed parameters matches the node['platform_family'] attribute that is detected by Ohai during every Chef Infra Client run.

Use the platform_family? method to ensure that certain actions are run for specific platform family. The platform_family? method will return true if one of the listed parameters matches the node['platform_family'] attribute that is detected by Ohai during every chef-client run.
trans-unit.target: Usa la platform_family? método para garantizar que ciertas acciones se ejecuten para una familia de plataformas específica. La platform_family? El método devolverá verdadero si uno de los parámetros enumerados coincide con el atributo node['platform_family'] que Ohai detecta durante cada ejecución chef-cliente.

trans-unit.source: Use the plugins top-level configuration field to provide configuration settings to plugins that you use with Chef InSpec. Refer to the documentation of the plugin you are using for details regarding what settings are available.
Use the policy set argument to set the policy group and policy name for a node.
Use the port Chef InSpec audit resource to test basic port properties, such as port, process, if it’s listening.
Use the postfix_conf Chef InSpec audit resource to test the main configuration of the Postfix Mail Transfer Agent.

Use the postgres_conf Chef InSpec audit resource to test the contents of the configuration file for PostgreSQL, typically located at /etc/postgresql/<version>/main/postgresql.conf or /var/lib/postgres/data/postgresql.conf, depending on the platform.
Use the postgres_hba_conf Chef InSpec audit resource to test the client authentication data defined in the pg_hba.conf file.
Use the postgres_ident_conf Chef InSpec audit resource to test the client authentication data defined in the pg_ident.conf file.
Use the postgres_session Chef InSpec audit resource to test SQL commands run against a PostgreSQL database.
Use the powershell Chef InSpec audit resource to test a Powershell script on the Windows platform.
Use the processes Chef InSpec audit resource to test properties for programs that are running on the system.

trans-unit.source: Use the provision.rb recipe to build any infrastructure that is necessary to run an application. This recipe will discover all metadata.rb and/or metadata.json files that are located in the project’s root directory, plus any cookbook directories located under cookbooks/<project_cookbooks>.

Use the ps_credential helper to embed a PSCredential object— a set of security credentials, such as a user name or password —within a script, which allows that script to be run using security credentials.

Use the ps_credential helper to embed a PSCredential object—a set of security credentials, such as a user name or password—within a script, which allows that script to be run using security credentials.
trans-unit.target: Use el ayudante ps_credential para incrustar un objeto PSCredential (un conjunto de credenciales de seguridad, como un nombre de usuario o contraseña) dentro de un script, que permite que ese script se ejecute usando credenciales de seguridad.

trans-unit.source: Use the publish.rb recipe to make any artifact generated by this project available to other phases in the Chef Automate pipeline.
Use the quality.rb recipe to run additional code quality and reporting tools.
Use the rabbitmq_config Chef InSpec audit resource to test configuration data for the RabbitMQ daemon located at /etc/rabbitmq/rabbitmq.config on Linux and Unix platforms.
Use the raise keyword to stop a Chef Infra Client run by triggering an unhandled exception
Use the raise keyword to stop a chef-client run by triggering an unhandled exception
trans-unit.target: Use la palabra clave raise para detener la ejecución de un chef-cliente activando una excepción no controlada

trans-unit.source: Use the reboot_pending? method to test if a node needs a reboot, or is expected to reboot. reboot_pending? returns true when the node needs a reboot.
trans-unit.target: Utilice el reboot_pending? método para probar si un nodo necesita reiniciar, o si se espera que se reinicie. reboot_pending? devuelve true cuando el nodo necesita reiniciar.

trans-unit.source: Use the recipe_name method to return the name of a recipe.
trans-unit.target: Use el método recipe_name para devolver el nombre de una receta.

trans-unit.source: Use the reconfigure subcommand to reconfigure a machine in the Chef Infra Server backend HA cluster. This subcommand will also restart any services for which the service_name['enabled'] setting is set to true.
Use the registry_data_exists? method to find out if a Microsoft Windows registry key contains the specified data of the specified type under the value.
trans-unit.target: Usa el registry_data_exists? método para averiguar si una clave de registro de Microsoft Windows contiene los datos especificados del tipo especificado bajo el valor.

trans-unit.source: Use the registry_get_subkeys method to get a list of registry key values that are present for a Microsoft Windows registry key.
trans-unit.target: Use el método registry_get_subkeys para obtener una lista de valores de clave de registro que están presentes para una clave de registro de Microsoft Windows.

trans-unit.source: Use the registry_get_values method to get the registry key values (name, type, and data) for a Microsoft Windows registry key.
trans-unit.target: Use el método registry_get_values para obtener los valores de clave de registro (nombre, tipo y datos) para una clave de registro de Microsoft Windows.

trans-unit.source: Use the registry_has_subkeys? method to find out if a Microsoft Windows registry key has one (or more) values.
trans-unit.target: Utilice el registry_has_subkeys? método para averiguar si una clave de registro de Microsoft Windows tiene uno (o más) valores.

trans-unit.source: Use the registry_key Chef InSpec audit resource to test key values in the Windows registry.
Use the registry_key_exists? method to find out if a Microsoft Windows registry key exists at the specified path.
trans-unit.target: ¿Usar el registry_key_exists? método para averiguar si existe una clave de registro de Microsoft Windows en la ruta especificada.

trans-unit.source: Use the registry_value_exists? method to find out if a registry key value exists. Use registry_data_exists? to test for the type and data of a registry key value.
trans-unit.target: ¿Usar el registry_value_exists? método para averiguar si existe un valor de clave de registro. ¿Utiliza registry_data_exists? para probar el tipo y los datos de un valor de clave de registro.

trans-unit.source: Use the remove-node subcommand to remove the named node from the backend HA cluster by removing the node’s status from etcd and deleting it from the etcd cluster. This command is useful when a node is going to be replaced or if the join-cluster command was unsuccessful.
Use the render method in a template to reference a partial template file:
trans-unit.target: Use el método de render en una plantilla para hacer referencia a un archivo de plantilla parcial:

Use the reregister argument to regenerate an RSA key pair for a user. The public key will be stored on the Chef server and the private key will be displayed on STDOUT or written to a named file.
trans-unit.target: Utilice el argumento de nuevo reregister para regenerar un par de claves RSA para un usuario. La clave pública se almacenará en el servidor Chef y la clave privada se mostrará en STDOUT o se escribirá en un archivo con nombre.

trans-unit.source: Use the reregister argument to regenerate an RSA key pair for an API client. The public key will be stored on the Chef Infra Server and the private key will be displayed on STDOUT or written to a named file.

trans-unit.source: Use the restart subcommand to restart all services enabled on a machine in the Chef Infra Server backend HA cluster, or to restart an individual service by specifying the name of that service in the command.

Use the restore subcommand to restore a backup created by the chef-backend-ctl backup subcommand. This command should be executed on the leader node in the backend HA cluster. This command will delete all existing data and replace it with the data in the backup archive.
Use the return keyword to stop processing a recipe based on a condition, but continue processing a Chef Infra Client run
Use the return keyword to stop processing a recipe based on a condition, but continue processing the chef-client run
trans-unit.target: Use la palabra clave return para detener el procesamiento de una receta en función de una condición, pero continúe procesando la ejecución chef-cliente

trans-unit.source: Use the review subcommand to submit a feature branch for review as a new patchset. This either creates a new change associated with the feature branch, or adds a new patchset on an existing change in the pipeline. When the new patchset has been created, the Verify stage for the associated change is automatically triggered and runs the unit, lint and syntax phases. By default, this action opens a browser window to show the pipeline in Chef Automate.
Use the run_list add argument to add run-list items (roles or recipes) to a node.
trans-unit.target: Use el argumento run_list add para agregar elementos de la lista de ejecución (roles o recetas) a un nodo.

trans-unit.source: Use the run_list remove argument to remove run-list items (roles or recipes) from a node. A recipe must be in one of the following formats: fully qualified, cookbook, or default. Both roles and recipes must be in quotes, for example: 'role[ROLE_NAME]' or 'recipe[COOKBOOK::RECIPE_NAME]'. Use a comma to separate roles and recipes when removing more than one, like this: 'recipe[COOKBOOK::RECIPE_NAME],COOKBOOK::RECIPE_NAME,role[ROLE_NAME]'.
trans-unit.target: Utilice el argumento de run_list remove para eliminar elementos de la lista de ejecución (roles o recetas) de un nodo. Una receta debe estar en uno de los siguientes formatos: totalmente calificado, libro de cocina o predeterminado. Tanto los roles como las recetas deben estar entre comillas, por ejemplo: 'role[ROLE_NAME]' o 'recipe[COOKBOOK::RECIPE_NAME]' . Use una coma para separar los roles y las recetas cuando elimine más de uno, así: 'recipe[COOKBOOK::RECIPE_NAME],COOKBOOK::RECIPE_NAME,role[ROLE_NAME]' .

trans-unit.source: Use the run_list set argument to set the run-list for a node. A recipe must be in one of the following formats: fully qualified, cookbook, or default. Both roles and recipes must be in quotes, for example: "role[ROLE_NAME]" or "recipe[COOKBOOK::RECIPE_NAME]". Use a comma to separate roles and recipes when setting more than one, like this: "recipe[COOKBOOK::RECIPE_NAME],COOKBOOK::RECIPE_NAME,role[ROLE_NAME]".

Use the run_list set argument to set the run-list for a node. A recipe must be in one of the following formats: fully qualified, cookbook, or default. Both roles and recipes must be in quotes, for example: 'role[ROLE_NAME]' or 'recipe[COOKBOOK::RECIPE_NAME]'. Use a comma to separate roles and recipes when setting more than one, like this: 'recipe[COOKBOOK::RECIPE_NAME],COOKBOOK::RECIPE_NAME,role[ROLE_NAME]'.
trans-unit.target: Utilice el argumento de run_list set para establecer la lista de ejecución para un nodo. Una receta debe estar en uno de los siguientes formatos: totalmente calificado, libro de cocina o predeterminado. Tanto los roles como las recetas deben estar entre comillas, por ejemplo: 'role[ROLE_NAME]' o 'recipe[COOKBOOK::RECIPE_NAME]' . Use una coma para separar los roles y las recetas al configurar más de uno, como este: 'recipe[COOKBOOK::RECIPE_NAME],COOKBOOK::RECIPE_NAME,role[ROLE_NAME]' .

trans-unit.source: Use the run_lock_timeout setting in the client.rb file to specify the amount of time (in seconds) to wait for the lock file associated with an in-progress Chef Infra Client run to be deleted.
Use the run_lock_timeout setting in the client.rb file to specify the amount of time (in seconds) to wait for the lock file associated with an in-progress chef-client run to be deleted.
trans-unit.target: Use la configuración run_lock_timeout en el archivo client.rb para especificar la cantidad de tiempo (en segundos) para esperar a que se elimine el archivo de bloqueo asociado con una ejecución chef-cliente en progreso.

trans-unit.source: Use the runit_service Chef InSpec audit resource to test a service using runit.
Use the sea:power re-creation step above first, to follow the difference in the vault permissions.
trans-unit.target: Use el paso de recreación sea:power anterior primero, para seguir la diferencia en los permisos de la bóveda.

trans-unit.source: Use the sea:power recreation step above first, to follow the difference in the vault permissions.
trans-unit.target: Utilice el sea:power paso de recreación de energía arriba primero, para seguir la diferencia en los permisos de la bóveda.

trans-unit.source: Use the search argument to search for a cookbook at https://supermarket.chef.io/cookbooks. A search query is used to return a list of cookbooks at https://supermarket.chef.io/cookbooks and uses the same syntax as the knife search subcommand.
trans-unit.target: Utilice la search argumento para buscar un libro de cocina en https://supermarket.chef.io/cookbooks . Una consulta de búsqueda se utiliza para devolver una lista de libros de cocina en https://supermarket.chef.io/cookbooks y utiliza la misma sintaxis que el subcomando de knife search .

trans-unit.source: Use the search argument to search for a cookbook at the Chef Supermarket. A search query is used to return a list of cookbooks at the Chef Supermarket and uses the same syntax as the knife search subcommand.
Use the search argument to search for a cookbooks located at Chef Supermarket. A search query is used to return a list of these cookbooks and uses the same syntax as the knife search subcommand.
Use the search command to search for remote gems available for installation:
Use the search method to perform a search query against the Chef Infra Server from within a recipe.
Use the search method to perform a search query against the Chef server from within a recipe.
trans-unit.target: Use el método de search para realizar una consulta de búsqueda en el servidor de Chef desde una receta.

trans-unit.source: Use the security.rb recipe to execute security tests against a project’s source code.
Use the security_identifier Chef InSpec resource to test the Security Identifier (SID) for user and group trustees on Windows.
Use the security_policy Chef InSpec audit resource to test security policies on the Windows platform.

Use the server create argument to create a new Microsoft Azure cloud instance. This will provision a new image in Microsoft Azure, perform a bootstrap (using the SSH protocol), and then install Chef Infra Client on the target system so that it can be used to configure the node and to communicate with a Chef Infra Server.
Use the server create argument to provision a new server in Azure and then perform a Chef bootstrap.
Use the server delete argument to delete existing ARM servers configured in the Azure account.

Use the server delete argument to delete one or more instances that are running in the Microsoft Azure cloud. To find a specific cloud instance, use knife azure server list. Use the --purge option to delete all associated node and client objects from the Chef Infra Server or use the knife node delete and knife client delete subcommands to delete specific node and client objects.
Use the server list argument to find instances that are associated with a Microsoft Azure account. The results may show instances that are not currently managed by the Chef Infra Server.
Use the server list argument to output a list of all ARM servers–including those not managed by the Chef server—in the Azure account.
Use the server show argument to output the details of an ARM server in the Azure account.
Use the server show argument to show the details for the named server (or servers).
Use the service-list subcommand to display a list of all available services on a machine in the Chef Infra Server backend HA cluster. A service that is enabled is labeled with an asterisk (*).
Use the service Chef InSpec audit resource to test if the named service is installed, running and/or enabled.
Use the set-chef command to enable Chef on any virtual machine running on Microsoft Azure.
Use the set-cluster-failover subcommand to enable or disable failover across the backend HA cluster.
Use the set-node-failover subcommand to enable or disable failover for a node in the backend HA cluster.
Use the setup subcommand to set up one (or more) instances. Instances are based on the list of platforms in the kitchen.yml file.

Use the setup subcommand to set up the Chef Automate project. This will set up the configuration needed for a project to communicate with the Chef Automate server. Use the token subcommand to get an API token that allows authorized requests to be made to the server.

Use the shadow Chef InSpec audit resource to test the contents of /etc/shadow, which contains password details that are readable only by the root user. shadow is a plural resource. Like all plural resources, it functions by performing searches across multiple entries in the shadow file.

Use the share argument to add a cookbook to https://supermarket.chef.io/cookbooks. This action will require a user account and a certificate for https://supermarket.chef.io. By default, knife will use the user name and API key that is identified in the configuration file used during the upload; otherwise these values must be specified on the command line or in an alternate configuration file. If a cookbook already exists on https://supermarket.chef.io/cookbooks, then only an owner or maintainer of that cookbook can make updates.
trans-unit.target: Use el argumento de share para agregar un libro de cocina a https://supermarket.chef.io/cookbooks . Esta acción requerirá una cuenta de usuario y un certificado para https://supermarket.chef.io . De forma predeterminada, Knife utilizará el nombre de usuario y la clave API que se identifica en el archivo de configuración utilizado durante la carga; de lo contrario, estos valores deben especificarse en la línea de comando o en un archivo de configuración alternativo. Si ya existe un libro de cocina en https://supermarket.chef.io/cookbooks , solo un propietario o mantenedor de ese libro de cocina puede realizar actualizaciones.

trans-unit.source: Use the share argument to add a cookbook to Chef Supermarket. This action will require a user account and a certificate for Chef Supermarket. By default, knife will use the user name and API key that is identified in the configuration file used during the upload; otherwise these values must be specified on the command line or in an alternate configuration file. If a cookbook already exists in Chef Supermarket, then only an owner or maintainer of that cookbook can make updates.

Use the share argument to add a cookbook to the Chef Supermarket. This action will require a user account and a certificate for Chef Supermarket. By default, knife will use the user name and API key that is identified in the configuration file used during the upload; otherwise these values must be specified on the command line or in an alternate configuration file. If a cookbook already exists on the Chef Supermarket, then only an owner or maintainer of that cookbook can make updates.
Use the show argument to display information about a node.
trans-unit.target: Use el argumento show para mostrar información sobre un nodo.

trans-unit.source: Use the show argument to display information about the specified environment.
trans-unit.target: Use el argumento show para mostrar información sobre el entorno especificado.

trans-unit.source: Use the show argument to show the details of a user.
trans-unit.target: Use el argumento show para mostrar los detalles de un usuario.

trans-unit.source: Use the show argument to show the details of an API client.
trans-unit.target: Use el argumento show para mostrar los detalles de un cliente API.

trans-unit.source: Use the show argument to view information about a cookbook located at Chef Supermarket.
Use the show argument to view information about a cookbook on https://supermarket.chef.io/cookbooks.
trans-unit.target: Use el argumento show para ver información sobre un libro de cocina en https://supermarket.chef.io/cookbooks .

trans-unit.source: Use the show argument to view information about a cookbook on the Chef Supermarket.

Use the show argument to view information about a cookbook, parts of a cookbook (attributes, definitions, files, libraries, providers, recipes, resources, and templates), or a file that is associated with a cookbook (including attributes such as checksum or specificity).
trans-unit.target: Utilice el argumento show para ver información sobre un libro de cocina, partes de un libro de cocina (atributos, definiciones, archivos, bibliotecas, proveedores, recetas, recursos y plantillas) o un archivo asociado con un libro de cocina (incluidos atributos como suma de verificación o especificidad).

trans-unit.source: Use the show argument to view the contents of a data bag.
trans-unit.target: Use el argumento show para ver el contenido de una bolsa de datos.

trans-unit.source: Use the show argument to view the details of a role.
trans-unit.target: Use el argumento show para ver los detalles de un rol.

trans-unit.source: Use the smoke.rb recipe to run smoke tests against deployed build artifacts to ensure they were deployed correctly and are minimally functional.
Use the ssh_config Chef InSpec audit resource to test OpenSSH client configuration data located at /etc/ssh/ssh_config on Linux and Unix platforms.

Use the sshd_config Chef InSpec audit resource to test configuration data for the OpenSSH daemon located at /etc/ssh/sshd_config on Linux and Unix platforms. sshd—the OpenSSH daemon—listens on dedicated ports, starts a daemon for each incoming connection, and then handles encryption, authentication, key exchanges, command execution, and data exchanges.
Use the ssl Chef InSpec audit resource to test SSL settings for the named port.

Use the start subcommand to start all services that are enabled on a machine in the Chef Infra Server backend HA cluster. This command can also be run for an individual service by specifying the name of the service in the command.
Use the status subcommand to show the status of all services available to a node in the backend HA cluster. This subcommand has the following syntax:

Use the stop subcommand to stop all services enabled on the Chef Infra Server backend HA cluster. This command can also be run for an individual service by specifying the name of the service in the command.
Use the supports setting in the inspec.yml file to specify one (or more) platforms for which a profile is targeting. The list of supported platforms may contain the following:
Use the syntax.rb recipe to verify that changes result in syntactically correct code. This process may involve compiling the code or running a validator for interpreted languages.
Use the sys_info Chef InSpec audit resource to test for operating system properties for the named host, and then returns that info as standard output.
Use the systemd_service Chef InSpec audit resource to test a service using SystemD.
Use the sysv_service Chef InSpec audit resource to test a service using SystemV.

Use the tail subcommand to follow all of the logs for all services on a machine in the Chef Infra Server backend HA cluster. This command can also be run for an individual service by specifying the name of the service in the command.

Use the term subcommand to send a SIGTERM to all services on a machine in the Chef Infra Server backend HA cluster. This command can also be run for an individual service by specifying the name of the service in the command.

Use the test argument to test a cookbook for syntax errors. This argument uses Ruby syntax checking to verify every file in a cookbook that ends in .rb and Embedded Ruby (ERB). This argument will respect chefignore files when determining which cookbooks to test for syntax errors.
trans-unit.target: Utilice la test argumento para probar un libro de cocina para los errores de sintaxis. Este argumento utiliza la verificación de sintaxis de Ruby para verificar cada archivo en un libro de cocina que termina en .rb y Ruby incrustado (ERB). Este argumento respetará los archivos chefignore al determinar qué libros de cocina probar para detectar errores de sintaxis.

trans-unit.source: Use the test subcommand to test one (or more) verified instances. Instances are based on the list of platforms and suites in the kitchen.yml file. This subcommand will create a new instance (cleaning up a previous instance, if necessary), converge that instance, set up the test harness, verify the instance using that test harness, and then destroy the instance.
Use the token subcommand to manage a Chef Automate API token.
Use the unit.rb recipe to run unit tests for the project.
Use the unshare argument to stop the sharing of a cookbook at https://supermarket.chef.io/cookbooks. Only the maintainer of a cookbook may perform this action.
trans-unit.target: Usar la unshare argumento para detener la distribución de un libro de cocina en https://supermarket.chef.io/cookbooks . Solo el mantenedor de un libro de cocina puede realizar esta acción.

trans-unit.source: Use the unshare argument to stop the sharing of a cookbook at the Chef Supermarket. Only the maintainer of a cookbook may perform this action.
Use the unshare argument to stop the sharing of a cookbook located at Chef Supermarket. Only the maintainer of a cookbook may perform this action.

Use the updated_nodes_only setting to determine what data to include in each export. The default setting is true, which causes the aggregation of only the changed data of updated nodes since the last export. Set updated_nodes_only to false and it aggregates all data of updated nodes since the last export

Use the upload argument to upload one or more cookbooks (and any files that are associated with those cookbooks) from a local repository to the Chef Infra Server. Only files that do not already exist on the Chef Infra Server will be uploaded.

Use the upload argument to upload one or more cookbooks (and any files that are associated with those cookbooks) from a local repository to the Chef server. Only files that do not already exist on the Chef server will be uploaded.
trans-unit.target: Utilice la upload argumento para subir uno o más libros de cocina (y los archivos que están asociados con esos libros de cocina) desde un repositorio local al servidor Chef. Solo se cargarán los archivos que aún no existen en el servidor de Chef.

trans-unit.source: Use the upstart_service Chef InSpec audit resource to test a service using Upstart.
Use the user-create, user-delete, user-edit, user-list and user-show subcommands to manage users.
trans-unit.target: Usar la user-create , user-delete , user-edit , user-list y user-show subcomandos para administrar usuarios.

trans-unit.source: Use the user Chef InSpec audit resource to test user profiles for a single, known/expected local user, including the groups to which that user belongs, the frequency of required password changes, and the directory paths to home and shell.

Use the users Chef InSpec audit resource to look up all local users available on the system, and then test specific properties of those users. This resource does not return information about users that may be located on other systems, such as LDAP or Active Directory.

Use the value_for_platform method in a recipe to select a value based on the node['platform'] and node['platform_version'] attributes. These values are detected by Ohai during every Chef Infra Client run.
Use the value_for_platform method in a recipe to select a value based on the node['platform'] and node['platform_version'] attributes. These values are detected by Ohai during every chef-client run.
trans-unit.target: Use el método value_for_platform en una receta para seleccionar un valor basado en los atributos de node['platform'] y node['platform_version'] . Ohai detecta estos valores durante cada ejecución chef-cliente.

trans-unit.source: Use the value_for_platform_family method in a recipe to select a value based on the node['platform_family'] attribute. This value is detected by Ohai during every Chef Infra Client run.
Use the value_for_platform_family method in a recipe to select a value based on the node['platform_family'] attribute. This value is detected by Ohai during every chef-client run.
trans-unit.target: Utilice el método value_for_platform_family en una receta para seleccionar un valor basado en el atributo del node['platform_family'] . Ohai detecta este valor durante cada ejecución chef-cliente.

trans-unit.source: Use the vbscript Chef InSpec audit resource to test a VBScript on the Windows platform.
Use the verify subcommand to verify one (or more) instances. Instances are based on the list of platforms and suites in the kitchen.yml file.
Use the version subcommand to print the version of Kitchen.
Use the virtualization Chef InSpec audit resource to test the virtualization platform on which the system is running.
Use the vnet create argument to create a virtual network.
Use the vnet list argument to get a list of virtual networks.
Use the wc command to get the byte count of a large node object file. For example:
Use the wc command to get the character count of a large node object file. For example:
trans-unit.target: Use el comando wc para obtener el recuento de caracteres de un archivo de objeto de nodo grande. Por ejemplo:

trans-unit.source: Use the windows_feature Chef InSpec audit resource to test features on Windows via the Get-WindowsFeature cmdlet.
Use the windows_firewall Chef InSpec audit resource to test if a firewall profile is correctly configured on a Windows system.
Use the windows_firewall_rule Chef InSpec audit resource to test if a firewall rule is correctly configured on a Windows system.
Use the windows_hotfix Chef InSpec audit resource to test if the hotfix has been installed on a Windows system.

Use the windows_task Chef InSpec audit resource to test a scheduled tasks configuration on a Windows platform. Microsoft and application vendors use scheduled tasks to perform a variety of system maintenance tasks but system administrators can schedule their own.
Use the winrm argument to create a connection to one or more remote machines. As each connection is created, a password must be provided. This argument uses the same syntax as the search subcommand.

Use the with_run_context method to define a block that has a pointer to a location in the run_context hierarchy. Resources in recipes always run at the root of the run_context hierarchy, whereas custom resources and notification blocks always build a child run_context which contains their sub-resources.
trans-unit.target: Use el método with_run_context para definir un bloque que tenga un puntero a una ubicación en la jerarquía run_context . Los recursos en las recetas siempre se ejecutan en la raíz de la jerarquía run_context , mientras que los recursos personalizados y los bloques de notificación siempre crean un run_context secundario que contiene sus subrecursos.

trans-unit.source: Use the wmi Chef InSpec audit resource to test WMI settings on the Windows platform.
Use the x509_certificate Chef InSpec audit resource to test the fields and validity of an x.509 certificate.

Use the xinetd_conf Chef InSpec audit resource to test services under /etc/xinet.d on Linux and Unix platforms. xinetd—the extended Internet service daemon—listens on all ports, and then loads the appropriate program based on a request. The xinetd.conf file is typically located at /etc/xinetd.conf and contains a list of Internet services associated to the ports on which that service will listen. Only enabled services may handle a request; only services that are required by the system should be enabled.
Use the xml Chef InSpec audit resource to test data in an XML file.
Use the yaml Chef InSpec audit resource to test configuration data in a Yaml file.
Use the yum Chef InSpec audit resource to test packages in the Yum repository.
Use the zfs_dataset Chef InSpec audit resource to test the ZFS datasets on FreeBSD systems.
Use the zfs_pool Chef InSpec audit resource to test the ZFS pools on FreeBSD systems.

Use the Event Feed for actionable insights and operational visibility. The Event Feed shows the time of the event, its type, the object acted upon, the action, and the initiating action. The Guitar Strings visualization helps you drill into infrastructure and compliance automation events and quickly isolate errors.
Use the Profile tab to:
Use the Controls tab to examine the compliance controls installed under your individual user account.

Use the Create global permission to define which users and groups may create the following server object types: cookbooks, data bags, environments, nodes, roles, and tags. This permission is required for any user who uses the knife [object] create argument to interact with objects on the Chef Infra Server.

Use the Create global permission to define which users and groups may create the following server object types: cookbooks, data bags, environments, nodes, roles, and tags. This permission is required for any user who uses the knife [object] create argument to interact with objects on the Chef server.
trans-unit.target: Use el permiso Crear global para definir qué usuarios y grupos pueden crear los siguientes tipos de objetos de servidor: libros de cocina, bolsas de datos, entornos, nodos, roles y etiquetas. Este permiso se requiere para cualquier usuario que use el argumento de knife [object] create para interactuar con objetos en el servidor Chef.

trans-unit.source: Use the Delete permission to define which users and groups may delete an object. This permission is required for any user who uses the knife [object] delete [object_name] argument to interact with objects on the Chef Infra Server.

Use the Delete permission to define which users and groups may delete an object. This permission is required for any user who uses the knife [object] delete [object_name] argument to interact with objects on the Chef server.
trans-unit.target: Use el permiso Eliminar para definir qué usuarios y grupos pueden eliminar un objeto. Este permiso se requiere para cualquier usuario que use el argumento knife [object] delete [object_name] para interactuar con objetos en el servidor Chef.

trans-unit.source: Use the Grant permission to define which users and groups may configure permissions on an object. This permission is required for any user who configures permissions using the Administration tab in the Chef management console.
trans-unit.target: Use el permiso Grant para definir qué usuarios y grupos pueden configurar permisos en un objeto. Este permiso se requiere para cualquier usuario que configure permisos usando la pestaña Administración en la consola de administración de Chef.

trans-unit.source: Use the List global permission to define which users and groups may view the following server object types: cookbooks, data bags, environments, nodes, roles, and tags. This permission is required for any user who uses the knife [object] list argument to interact with objects on the Chef Infra Server.

Use the List global permission to define which users and groups may view the following server object types: cookbooks, data bags, environments, nodes, roles, and tags. This permission is required for any user who uses the knife [object] list argument to interact with objects on the Chef server.
trans-unit.target: Use el permiso global Lista para definir qué usuarios y grupos pueden ver los siguientes tipos de objetos de servidor: libros de cocina, bolsas de datos, entornos, nodos, roles y etiquetas. Este permiso es necesario para cualquier usuario que use el argumento de la knife [object] list para interactuar con objetos en el servidor Chef.

trans-unit.source: Use the Profiles tab to examine the compliance profiles installed under your individual user account.

Use the Read permission to define which users and groups may view the details of an object. This permission is required for any user who uses the knife [object] show [object_name] argument to interact with objects on the Chef Infra Server.

Use the Read permission to define which users and groups may view the details of an object. This permission is required for any user who uses the knife [object] show [object_name] argument to interact with objects on the Chef server.
trans-unit.target: Use el permiso Leer para definir qué usuarios y grupos pueden ver los detalles de un objeto. Este permiso es necesario para cualquier usuario que use el argumento knife [object] show [object_name] para interactuar con objetos en el servidor Chef.

trans-unit.source: Use the Save Notification button to create the Slack notification.
Use the Save Notification button to create the webhook notification.
Use the Save Notification button to save the Slack notification.
Use the Save Notification button to save the webhook notification.
Use the Save button to save your changes
Use the Send Test button to try out your webhook notification.
Use the Send a test button to try out your Slack notification. If your Slack notification does not appear, return to the Slack Webhooks Integration page to re-check the recipient and URL.

Use the Update permission to define which users and groups may edit the details of an object. This permission is required for any user who uses the knife [object] edit [object_name] argument to interact with objects on the Chef Infra Server and for any Chef Infra Client to save node data to the Chef Infra Server at the conclusion of a Chef Infra Client run.

Use the Update permission to define which users and groups may edit the details of an object. This permission is required for any user who uses the knife [object] edit [object_name] argument to interact with objects on the Chef server and for any chef-client to save node data to the Chef server at the conclusion of a chef-client run.
trans-unit.target: Use el permiso Actualizar para definir qué usuarios y grupos pueden editar los detalles de un objeto. Este permiso es necesario para cualquier usuario que use el argumento knife [object] edit [object_name] para interactuar con objetos en el servidor Chef y para cualquier chef-cliente guardar datos de nodo en el servidor Chef al finalizar una ejecución chef-cliente .

trans-unit.source: Use the apt_package resource to manage packages for the Debian and Ubuntu platforms.
trans-unit.target: Use el recurso apt_package para administrar paquetes para las plataformas Debian y Ubuntu.

trans-unit.source: Use the apt_package resource to manage packages on Debian and Ubuntu platforms.
Use the apt_preference resource to create APT preference files. Preference files are used to control which package versions and sources are prioritized during installation.
Use the apt_repository resource to specify additional APT repositories. Adding a new repository will update the APT package cache immediately.
Use the apt_update resource to manage APT repository updates on Debian and Ubuntu platforms.
Use the apt_update resource to manage Apt repository updates on Debian and Ubuntu platforms.
trans-unit.target: Use el recurso apt_update para administrar las actualizaciones del repositorio de Apt en las plataformas Debian y Ubuntu.

trans-unit.source: Use the archive_file resource to extract archive files to disk. This resource uses the libarchive library to extract multiple archive formats including tar, gzip, bzip, and zip formats.

Use the bash resource to execute scripts using the Bash interpreter. This resource may also use any of the actions and properties that are available to the execute resource. Commands that are executed with this resource are (by their nature) not idempotent, as they are typically unique to the environment in which they are run. Use not_if and only_if to guard this resource for idempotence.
trans-unit.target: Use el recurso bash para ejecutar scripts con el intérprete Bash. Este recurso también puede usar cualquiera de las acciones y propiedades que están disponibles para el recurso de ejecución . Los comandos que se ejecutan con este recurso no son (por su naturaleza) idempotentes, ya que suelen ser exclusivos del entorno en el que se ejecutan. Use not_if y only_if para proteger este recurso para la idempotencia.

trans-unit.source: Use the bash resource to install the package on the node, but only when the package is not already installed
trans-unit.target: Use el recurso bash para instalar el paquete en el nodo, pero solo cuando el paquete no esté instalado

trans-unit.source: Use the batch resource to execute a batch script using the cmd.exe interpreter on Windows. The batch resource creates and executes a temporary file (similar to how the script resource behaves), rather than running the command inline. Commands that are executed with this resource are (by their nature) not idempotent, as they are typically unique to the environment in which they are run. Use not_if and only_if to guard this resource for idempotence.

Use the batch resource to execute a batch script using the cmd.exe interpreter. The batch resource creates and executes a temporary file (similar to how the script resource behaves), rather than running the command inline. This resource inherits actions (:run and :nothing) and properties (creates, cwd, environment, group, path, timeout, and user) from the execute resource. Commands that are executed with this resource are (by their nature) not idempotent, as they are typically unique to the environment in which they are run. Use not_if and only_if to guard this resource for idempotence.
trans-unit.target: Use el recurso por lotes para ejecutar un script por lotes utilizando el intérprete cmd.exe. El recurso por lotes crea y ejecuta un archivo temporal (similar al comportamiento del recurso de script ), en lugar de ejecutar el comando en línea. Este recurso hereda acciones ( :run y :nothing ) y propiedades ( creates , cwd , environment , group , path , timeout y user ) de la ejecuciónrecurso. Los comandos que se ejecutan con este recurso no son (por su naturaleza) idempotentes, ya que suelen ser exclusivos del entorno en el que se ejecutan. Use not_if y only_if para proteger este recurso para la idempotencia.

trans-unit.source: Use the bff_package resource to manage packages for the AIX platform using the installp utility. When a package is installed from a local file, it must be added to the node using the remote_file or cookbook_file resources.
trans-unit.target: Utilice el recurso bff_package para gestionar paquetes para la plataforma AIX utilizando la utilidad installp. Cuando un paquete se instala desde un archivo local, debe agregarse al nodo utilizando los recursos remote_file o cookbook_file .

trans-unit.source: Use the breakpoint resource to add breakpoints to recipes. Run the chef-shell in Chef Infra Client mode, and then use those breakpoints to debug recipes. Breakpoints are ignored by Chef Infra Client during an actual Chef Infra Client run. That said, breakpoints are typically used to debug recipes only when running them in a non-production environment, after which they are removed from those recipes before the parent cookbook is uploaded to the Chef Infra Server.

Use the breakpoint resource to add breakpoints to recipes. Run the chef-shell in Chef Infra Client mode, and then use those breakpoints to debug recipes. Breakpoints are ignored by the chef-client during an actual chef-client run. That said, breakpoints are typically used to debug recipes only when running them in a non-production environment, after which they are removed from those recipes before the parent cookbook is uploaded to the Chef server.

Use the breakpoint resource to add breakpoints to recipes. Run the chef-shell in chef-client mode, and then use those breakpoints to debug recipes. Breakpoints are ignored by the chef-client during an actual chef-client run. That said, breakpoints are typically used to debug recipes only when running them in a non-production environment, after which they are removed from those recipes before the parent cookbook is uploaded to the Chef server.
trans-unit.target: Use el recurso de punto de interrupción para agregar puntos de interrupción a las recetas. Ejecute chef-shell en modo chef-cliente y luego use esos puntos de interrupción para depurar recetas. Los puntos de interrupción son ignorados por el chef-cliente durante una ejecución real de chef-cliente. Dicho esto, los puntos de interrupción generalmente se usan para depurar recetas solo cuando se ejecutan en un entorno que no es de producción, después de lo cual se eliminan de esas recetas antes de que el libro de cocina principal se cargue en el servidor Chef.

trans-unit.source: Use the build_essential resource to install the packages required for compiling C software from source.
Use the cab_package resource to install or remove Microsoft Windows cabinet (.cab) packages.
Use the chef_acl resource to interact with access control lists (ACLs) that exist on the Chef Infra Server.
Use the chef_client resource to create clients on your Chef Infra Server from within Chef Infra cookbook code.

Use the chef_client_config resource to create a client.rb file in the Chef Infra Client configuration directory. See the client.rb docs for more details on options available in the client.rb configuration file.

Use the chef_client_config resource to create a client.rb file in the Chef Infra Client configuration directory. See the client.rb docs for more details on options available in the client.rb configuration file.
Use the chef_client_cron resource to setup the Chef Infra Client to run as a cron job. This resource will also create the specified log directory if it doesn’t already exist.
Use the chef_client_launchd resource to configure the Chef Infra Client to run on a schedule.
Use the chef_client_scheduled_task resource to setup the Chef Infra Client to run as a Windows scheduled task. This resource will also create the specified log directory if it doesn’t already exist.
Use the chef_client_systemd_timer resource to setup the Chef Infra Client to run as a systemd timer.

Use the chef_client_trusted_certificate resource to add certificates to Chef Infra Client’s trusted certificate directory. This allows the Chef Infra Client to communicate with internal encrypted resources without errors.
Use the chef_container resource to interact with container objects that exist on the Chef Infra Server.
Use the chef_data_bag resource to manage data bags.
Use the chef_data_bag_item resource to manage data bag items.
Use the chef_environment resource to manage environments.

Use the chef_gem resource to install a gem only for the instance of Ruby that is dedicated to the chef-client. When a gem is installed from a local file, it must be added to the node using the remote_file or cookbook_file resources.

Use the chef_gem resource to install a gem only for the instance of Ruby that is dedicated to the chef-client. When a package is installed from a local file, it must be added to the node using the remote_file or cookbook_file resources.
trans-unit.target: Use el recurso chef_gem para instalar una gema solo para la instancia de Ruby que está dedicada al chef-cliente. Cuando un paquete se instala desde un archivo local, debe agregarse al nodo utilizando los recursos remote_file o cookbook_file .

trans-unit.source: Use the chef_gem resource to install gems that are needed by Chef Infra Client during the execution phase.
Use the chef_gem resource to install gems that are needed by the chef-client during the execution phase.
trans-unit.target: Use el recurso chef_gem para instalar las gemas que necesita el chef-cliente durante la fase de ejecución.

trans-unit.source: Use the chef_group resource to interact with group objects that exist on the Chef server.

Use the chef_handler resource to enable handlers during a Chef Infra Client run. The resource allows arguments to be passed to Chef Infra Client, which then applies the conditions defined by the custom handler to the node attribute data collected during a Chef Infra Client run, and then processes the handler based on that data. The chef_handler resource is typically defined early in a node’s run-list (often being the first item). This ensures that all of the handlers will be available for the entire Chef Infra Client run.

Use the chef_handler resource to enable handlers during a chef-client run. The resource allows arguments to be passed to the chef-client, which then applies the conditions defined by the custom handler to the node attribute data collected during the chef-client run, and then processes the handler based on that data.
trans-unit.target: Use el recurso chef_handler para habilitar controladores durante una ejecución chef-cliente. El recurso permite que los argumentos pasen al chef-cliente, que luego aplica las condiciones definidas por el controlador personalizado a los datos de atributos del nodo recopilados durante la ejecución del chef-cliente, y luego procesa el controlador en función de esos datos.

trans-unit.source: Use the chef_node resource to manage nodes.
Use the chef_organization resource to interact with organization objects that exist on the Chef Infra Server.
Use the chef_role resource to manage roles.

Use the chef_sleep resource to pause (sleep) for a number of seconds during a Chef Infra Client run. Only use this resource when a command or service exits successfully but is not ready for the next step in a recipe.
Use the chef_user resource to manage users.
Use the chef_vault_secret resource to store secrets in Chef Vault items. Where possible and relevant, this resource attempts to map behavior and functionality to the knife vault sub-commands.
Use the chocolatey_config resource to add or remove Chocolatey configuration keys.
Use the chocolatey_feature resource to enable and disable Chocolatey features.
Use the chocolatey_package resource to manage packages using Chocolatey for the Microsoft Windows platform.
trans-unit.target: Use el recurso chocolatey_package para administrar paquetes usando Chocolatey para la plataforma Microsoft Windows.

trans-unit.source: Use the chocolatey_package resource to manage packages using Chocolatey on the Microsoft Windows platform.
Use the chocolatey_source resource to add, remove, enable, or disable Chocolatey sources.

Use the cookbook_file resource to copy a file from a cookbook’s /files directory. Use the template resource to create a file based on a template in a cookbook’s /templates directory. And use the remote_file resource to transfer a file to a node from a remote location.
trans-unit.target: Use el recurso cookbook_file para copiar un archivo del directorio /files de un libro de cocina . Use el recurso de plantilla para crear un archivo basado en una plantilla en el directorio /templates de un libro de cocina . Y use el recurso remote_file para transferir un archivo a un nodo desde una ubicación remota.

trans-unit.source: Use the cookbook_file resource to transfer files from a sub-directory of COOKBOOK_NAME/files/ to a specified path located on a host that is running Chef Infra Client. The file is selected according to file specificity, which allows different source files to be used based on the hostname, host platform (operating system, distro, or as appropriate), or platform version. Files that are located in the COOKBOOK_NAME/files/default sub-directory may be used on any platform.
