Use the cookbook_file resource to transfer files from a sub-directory of COOKBOOK_NAME/files/ to a specified path located on a host that is running the chef-client. The file is selected according to file specificity, which allows different source files to be used based on the hostname, host platform (operating system, distro, or as appropriate), or platform version. Files that are located in the COOKBOOK_NAME/files/default sub-directory may be used on any platform.
trans-unit.target: Use el recurso cookbook_file para transferir archivos desde un subdirectorio de COOKBOOK_NAME/files/ a una ruta especificada ubicada en un host que ejecuta el chef-cliente. El archivo se selecciona de acuerdo con la especificidad del archivo, lo que permite utilizar diferentes archivos fuente en función del nombre de host, la plataforma de host (sistema operativo, distribución o según corresponda) o la versión de la plataforma. Los archivos que se encuentran en el COOKBOOK_NAME/files/default se pueden usar en cualquier plataforma.

trans-unit.source: Use the cron resource to manage cron entries for time-based job scheduling.

Use the cron resource to manage cron entries for time-based job scheduling. Properties for a schedule will default to * if not provided. The cron resource requires access to a crontab program, typically cron.
trans-unit.target: Use el recurso cron para administrar las entradas cron para la programación de trabajos basada en el tiempo. Las propiedades de una programación tendrán un valor predeterminado * si no se proporcionan. El recurso cron requiere acceso a un programa crontab, generalmente cron.

trans-unit.source: Use the cron_access resource to manage cron’s cron.allow and cron.deny files.
Use the cron_d resource to manage cron job files in the /etc/cron.d directory.

Use the csh resource to execute scripts using the csh interpreter. This resource may also use any of the actions and properties that are available to the execute resource. Commands that are executed with this resource are (by their nature) not idempotent, as they are typically unique to the environment in which they are run. Use not_if and only_if to guard this resource for idempotence.
trans-unit.target: Use el recurso csh para ejecutar scripts con el intérprete csh. Este recurso también puede usar cualquiera de las acciones y propiedades que están disponibles para el recurso de ejecución . Los comandos que se ejecutan con este recurso no son (por su naturaleza) idempotentes, ya que suelen ser exclusivos del entorno en el que se ejecutan. Use not_if y only_if para proteger este recurso para la idempotencia.

trans-unit.source: Use the default.rb recipe to configure a project on a build node. This recipe is run by the Chef Infra Client as the root user and is a standard default recipe. The Chef Infra Client may use this recipe to configure this project on any node, whether or not it’s part of a Chef Automate pipeline.
Use the delivery-truck cookbook in your project
Use the deploy.rb recipe to define how artifacts are published to one (or more) nodes after they are built successfully. The contents of this recipe are project-specific.

Use the deploy resource to manage and control deployments. This is a popular resource, but is also complex, having the most properties, multiple providers, the added complexity of callbacks, plus four attributes that support layout modifications from within a recipe.
trans-unit.target: Use el recurso de implementación para administrar y controlar las implementaciones. Este es un recurso popular, pero también es complejo, ya que tiene la mayoría de las propiedades, múltiples proveedores, la complejidad adicional de las devoluciones de llamada, más cuatro atributos que admiten modificaciones de diseño desde una receta.

trans-unit.source: Use the directory resource to create the /var/www/vhosts directory on the node:
trans-unit.target: Use el recurso de directorio para crear el directorio /var/www/vhosts en el nodo:

trans-unit.source: Use the directory resource to manage a directory, which is a hierarchy of folders that comprises all of the information stored on a computer. The root directory is the top-level, under which the rest of the directory is organized. The directory resource uses the name property to specify the path to a location in a directory. Typically, permission to access that location in the directory is required.
trans-unit.target: Usa el directorio recurso de para administrar un directorio, que es una jerarquía de carpetas que comprende toda la información almacenada en una computadora. El directorio raíz es el nivel superior, bajo el cual se organiza el resto del directorio. El recurso de directorio utiliza la propiedad de name para especificar la ruta a una ubicación en un directorio. Por lo general, se requiere permiso para acceder a esa ubicación en el directorio.

trans-unit.source: Use the dmg_package resource to install a package from a .dmg file. The resource will retrieve the dmg file from a remote URL, mount it using macOS' hdidutil, copy the application (.app directory) to the specified destination (/Applications), and detach the image using hdiutil. The dmg file will be stored in the Chef::Config[:file_cache_path].

Use the dnf_package resource to install, upgrade, and remove packages with DNF for Fedora and RHEL 8+. The dnf_package resource is able to resolve provides data for packages much like DNF can do when it is run from the command line. This allows a variety of options for installing packages, like minimum versions, virtual provides and library names.
Use the dpkg_package resource to manage packages for the dpkg platform. When a package is installed from a local file, it must be added to the node using the remote_file or cookbook_file resources.
trans-unit.target: Usa el dpkg_package recurso para administrar paquetes para la plataforma dpkg. Cuando un paquete se instala desde un archivo local, debe agregarse al nodo utilizando los recursos remote_file o cookbook_file .

trans-unit.source: Use the easy_install_package resource to manage packages for the Python platform.
trans-unit.target: Use el recurso easy_install_package para administrar paquetes para la plataforma Python.

trans-unit.source: Use the env resource to manage environment keys in Microsoft Windows. After an environment key is set, Microsoft Windows must be restarted before the environment key will be available to the Task Scheduler.
trans-unit.target: Utilizar el recurso env para administrar las claves de entorno en Microsoft Windows. Después de configurar una clave de entorno, Microsoft Windows debe reiniciarse antes de que la clave de entorno esté disponible para el Programador de tareas.

trans-unit.source: Use the erl_call resource to connect to a node located within a distributed Erlang system. Commands that are executed with this resource are (by their nature) not idempotent, as they are typically unique to the environment in which they are run. Use not_if and only_if to guard this resource for idempotence.
trans-unit.target: Use el recurso erl_call para conectarse a un nodo ubicado dentro de un sistema Erlang distribuido. Los comandos que se ejecutan con este recurso no son (por su naturaleza) idempotentes, ya que suelen ser exclusivos del entorno en el que se ejecutan. Use not_if y only_if para proteger este recurso para la idempotencia.

trans-unit.source: Use the execute resource to execute a single command. Commands that are executed with this resource are (by their nature) not idempotent, as they are typically unique to the environment in which they are run. Use not_if and only_if to guard this resource for idempotence.
trans-unit.target: Usar la ejecución de recursos para ejecutar un solo comando. Los comandos que se ejecutan con este recurso no son (por su naturaleza) idempotentes, ya que suelen ser exclusivos del entorno en el que se ejecutan. Use not_if y only_if para proteger este recurso para la idempotencia.

trans-unit.source: Use the execute resource to run a single command. Use multiple execute resource blocks to run multiple commands.
trans-unit.target: Usar la ejecución de recursos para ejecutar un solo comando. Usa múltiples ejecutar bloques de recursos para ejecutar varios comandos.

trans-unit.source: Use the file resource to manage files directly on a node.
trans-unit.target: Usa el archivo recurso de para administrar archivos directamente en un nodo.

trans-unit.source: Use the freebsd_package resource to manage packages for the FreeBSD platform.
trans-unit.target: Use el paquete freebsd_ recurso para administrar paquetes para la plataforma FreeBSD.

trans-unit.source: Use the functional.rb recipe to run a set functional tests that are specific to this project. The tests are run on a single build node and should target and/or trigger tests against the set of nodes that are updated when this artifact deploys.

Use the gem_package resource to manage gem packages that are only included in recipes. When a gem is installed from a local file, it must be added to the node using the remote_file or cookbook_file resources.

Use the gem_package resource to manage gem packages that are only included in recipes. When a package is installed from a local file, it must be added to the node using the remote_file or cookbook_file resources.
trans-unit.target: Use el recurso gem_package para administrar paquetes de gemas que solo se incluyen en las recetas. Cuando un paquete se instala desde un archivo local, debe agregarse al nodo utilizando los recursos remote_file o cookbook_file .

trans-unit.source: Use the git resource to manage source control resources that exist in a git repository. git version 1.6.5 (or higher) is required to use all of the functionality in the git resource.
trans-unit.target: Use el recurso git para administrar los recursos de control de origen que existen en un repositorio git. Se requiere git versión 1.6.5 (o superior) para usar toda la funcionalidad en el recurso git .

trans-unit.source: Use the git resource to manage source control resources that exist in a git repository. git version 1.6.5 (or higher) is required to use all of the functionality in the git resource.
Use the group resource to manage a local group.
trans-unit.target: Use el recurso de grupo para administrar un grupo local.

trans-unit.source: Use the homebrew_cask resource to install binaries distributed via the Homebrew package manager.
Use the homebrew_package resource to manage packages for the Mac OS X platform.
trans-unit.target: Use el recurso homebrew_package para administrar paquetes para la plataforma Mac OS X.

trans-unit.source: Use the homebrew_package resource to manage packages for the macOS platform.
Use the homebrew_tap resource to add additional formula repositories to the Homebrew package manager.
Use the homebrew_update resource to manage Homebrew repository updates on macOS.
Use the hostname resource to set the system’s hostname, configure hostname and hosts config file, and re-run the Ohai hostname plugin so the hostname will be available in subsequent cookbooks.
Use the http_request resource to send an HTTP request (GET, PUT, POST, DELETE, HEAD, or OPTIONS) with an arbitrary message. This resource is often useful when custom callbacks are necessary.
trans-unit.target: Use el recurso http_request para enviar una solicitud HTTP ( GET , PUT , POST , DELETE , HEAD u OPTIONS ) con un mensaje arbitrario. Este recurso a menudo es útil cuando son necesarias devoluciones de llamada personalizadas.

trans-unit.source: Use the ifconfig resource to manage interfaces on Unix and Linux systems.
Use the ifconfig resource to manage interfaces.
trans-unit.target: Usa el ifconfig recurso para administrar las interfaces.

trans-unit.source: Use the ips_package resource to manage packages (using Image Packaging System (IPS)) on the Solaris 11 platform.
trans-unit.target: Use el recurso ips_package para administrar paquetes (usando Image Packaging System (IPS)) en la plataforma Solaris 11.

trans-unit.source: Use the kernel_module resource to manage kernel modules on Linux systems. This resource can load, unload, blacklist, disable, install, and uninstall modules.

Use the ksh resource to execute scripts using the Korn shell (ksh) interpreter. This resource may also use any of the actions and properties that are available to the execute resource. Commands that are executed with this resource are (by their nature) not idempotent, as they are typically unique to the environment in which they are run. Use not_if and only_if to guard this resource for idempotence.
trans-unit.target: Use el recurso ksh para ejecutar scripts utilizando el intérprete de shell Korn (ksh). Este recurso también puede usar cualquiera de las acciones y propiedades que están disponibles para el recurso de ejecución . Los comandos que se ejecutan con este recurso no son (por su naturaleza) idempotentes, ya que suelen ser exclusivos del entorno en el que se ejecutan. Use not_if y only_if para proteger este recurso para la idempotencia.

trans-unit.source: Use the launchd resource to manage system-wide services (daemons) and per-user services (agents) on the Mac OS X platform.
trans-unit.target: Use el recurso launchd para administrar servicios de todo el sistema (daemons) y servicios por usuario (agentes) en la plataforma Mac OS X.

trans-unit.source: Use the launchd resource to manage system-wide services (daemons) and per-user services (agents) on the macOS platform.
Use the link resource to create symbolic or hard links.
trans-unit.target: Use el recurso de enlace para crear enlaces simbólicos o duros.

trans-unit.source: Use the lint.rb recipe to run linting and other static analysis tools against a project’s source code.
Use the locale resource to set the system’s locale on Debian and Windows systems. Windows support was added in Chef Infra Client 16.0

Use the log resource to create log entries. The log resource behaves like any other resource: built into the resource collection during the compile phase, and then run during the execution phase. (To create a log entry that is not built into the resource collection, use Chef::Log instead of the log resource.)
trans-unit.target: Use el recurso de registro para crear entradas de registro. El recurso de registro se comporta como cualquier otro recurso: integrado en la colección de recursos durante la fase de compilación y luego se ejecuta durante la fase de ejecución. (Para crear una entrada de registro que no esté integrada en la colección de recursos, use Chef::Log lugar del recurso de registro ).

trans-unit.source: Use the macos_admin_control resource to require Admin level privileges to make system-wide changes
Use the macos_app_management resource to configure nodes to use Munki to manage apps
Use the macos_automatic_logout resource to set the system to automatically logout after a set time.
Use the macos_automatic_software_updates resource to configure system and application updates on macOS systems.
Use the macos_desktop_screensaver resource to configure secure screensaver settings on macOS systems.
Use the macos_disk_encryption resource to enforce FileVault encryption on macOS systems.
Use the macos_firewall resource to enable the firewall on macOS systems.
Use the macos_password_policy resource to set password complexity, password length, etc on macOS systems.
Use the macos_power_management resource to set the power settings of a kiosk-style device when you need it always-on

Use the macos_userdefaults resource to manage the macOS user defaults system. The properties of this resource are passed to the defaults command, and the parameters follow the convention of that command. See the defaults(1) man page for details on how the tool works.
Use the macports_package resource to manage packages for the Mac OS X platform.
trans-unit.target: Use el recurso macports_package para administrar paquetes para la plataforma Mac OS X.

trans-unit.source: Use the macports_package resource to manage packages for the macOS platform using the MacPorts package management system.

Use the mdadm resource to manage RAID devices in a Linux environment using the mdadm utility. The mdadm provider will create and assemble an array, but it will not create the config file that is used to persist the array upon reboot. If the config file is required, it must be done by specifying a template with the correct array layout, and then by using the mount provider to create a file systems table (fstab) entry.
trans-unit.target: Use el recurso mdadm para administrar dispositivos RAID en un entorno Linux utilizando la utilidad mdadm. El proveedor mdadm creará y ensamblará una matriz, pero no creará el archivo de configuración que se usa para conservar la matriz al reiniciar. Si se requiere el archivo de configuración, debe hacerse especificando una plantilla con el diseño de matriz correcto y luego utilizando el proveedor de montaje para crear una entrada de tabla de sistemas de archivos (fstab).

trans-unit.source: Use the mdadm resource to manage RAID devices in a Linux environment using the mdadm utility. The mdadm resource will create and assemble an array, but it will not create the config file that is used to persist the array upon reboot. If the config file is required, it must be done by specifying a template with the correct array layout, and then by using the mount provider to create a file systems table (fstab) entry.
Use the mount resource to manage a mounted file system.
trans-unit.target: Use el recurso de montaje para administrar un sistema de archivos montado.

trans-unit.source: Use the msu_package resource to install Microsoft Update(MSU) packages on Microsoft Windows machines.

Use the ohai resource to reload the Ohai configuration on a node. This allows recipes that change system attributes (like a recipe that adds a user) to refer to those attributes later on during the Chef Infra Client run.

Use the ohai resource to reload the Ohai configuration on a node. This allows recipes that change system attributes (like a recipe that adds a user) to refer to those attributes later on during the chef-client run.
trans-unit.target: Use el recurso ohai para recargar la configuración de Ohai en un nodo. Esto permite que las recetas que cambian los atributos del sistema (como una receta que agrega un usuario) se refieran a esos atributos más adelante durante la ejecución chef-cliente.

trans-unit.source: Use the ohai_hint resource to aid in configuration detection by passing hint data to Ohai.
Use the openbsd_package resource to manage packages for the OpenBSD platform.
trans-unit.target: Use el recurso openbsd_package para administrar paquetes para la plataforma OpenBSD.

trans-unit.source: Use the openssl_dhparam resource to generate dhparam.pem files. If a valid dhparam.pem file is found at the specified location, no new file will be created. If a file is found at the specified location but it is not a valid dhparam.pem file, it will be overwritten.

Use the openssl_ec_private_key resource to generate an elliptic curve (EC) private key file. If a valid EC key file can be opened at the specified location, no new file will be created. If the EC key file cannot be opened, either because it does not exist or because the password to the EC key file does not match the password in the recipe, then it will be overwritten.
Use the openssl_ec_public_key resource to generate elliptic curve (EC) public key files from a given EC private key.

Use the openssl_rsa_private_key resource to generate RSA private key files. If a valid RSA key file can be opened at the specified location, no new file will be created. If the RSA key file cannot be opened, either because it does not exist or because the password to the RSA key file does not match the password in the recipe, it will be overwritten.
Use the openssl_rsa_public_key resource to generate RSA public key files for a given RSA private key.

Use the openssl_x509_certificate resource to generate signed or self-signed, PEM-formatted x509 certificates. If no existing key is specified, the resource will automatically generate a passwordless key with the certificate. If a CA private key and certificate are provided, the certificate will be signed with them.
Use the openssl_x509_crl resource to generate PEM-formatted x509 certificate revocation list (CRL) files.

Use the openssl_x509_request resource to generate PEM-formatted x509 certificates requests. If no existing key is specified, the resource will automatically generate a passwordless key with the certificate.

Use the osx_profile resource to manage configuration profiles (.mobileconfig files) on the Mac OS X platform. The osx_profile resource installs profiles by using the uuidgen library to generate a unique ProfileUUID, and then using the profiles command to install the profile on the system.
trans-unit.target: Use el recurso osx_profile para administrar los perfiles de configuración ( archivos .mobileconfig ) en la plataforma Mac OS X. El recurso osx_profile instala perfiles usando la biblioteca uuidgen para generar un ProfileUUID único , y luego usando el comando profiles para instalar el perfil en el sistema.

trans-unit.source: Use the osx_profile resource to manage configuration profiles (.mobileconfig files) on the macOS platform. The osx_profile resource installs profiles by using the uuidgen library to generate a unique ProfileUUID, and then using the profiles command to install the profile on the system.
Use the package resource to install httpd:
trans-unit.target: Use el recurso del paquete para instalar httpd:

trans-unit.source: Use the package resource to manage packages. When the package is installed from a local file (such as with RubyGems, dpkg, or RPM Package Manager), the file must be added to the node using the remote_file or cookbook_file resources.
trans-unit.target: Use el recurso de paquete para administrar paquetes. Cuando el paquete se instala desde un archivo local (como con RubyGems, dpkg o RPM Package Manager), el archivo debe agregarse al nodo utilizando los recursos remote_file o cookbook_file .

trans-unit.source: Use the package, template (two times), directory, and service resources to define the website resource. Remember: order matters !
trans-unit.target: Use el paquete , la plantilla (dos veces), el directorio y los recursos del servicio para definir el recurso del website . Recuerde: ¡el orden importa!

trans-unit.source: Use the package, template (two times), directory, and service resources to define the website resource. Remember: order matters!
Use the pacman_package resource to manage packages (using pacman) on the Arch Linux platform.
trans-unit.target: Use el recurso pacman_package para administrar paquetes (usando pacman) en la plataforma Arch Linux.

trans-unit.source: Use the paludis_package resource to manage packages for the Paludis platform.
trans-unit.target: Use el recurso paludis_package para administrar paquetes para la plataforma Paludis.

trans-unit.source: Use the perl resource to execute scripts using the Perl interpreter. This resource may also use any of the actions and properties that are available to the execute resource. Commands that are executed with this resource are (by their nature) not idempotent, as they are typically unique to the environment in which they are run. Use not_if and only_if to guard this resource for idempotence.
trans-unit.target: Use el recurso perl para ejecutar scripts con el intérprete Perl. Este recurso también puede usar cualquiera de las acciones y propiedades que están disponibles para el recurso de ejecución . Los comandos que se ejecutan con este recurso no son (por su naturaleza) idempotentes, ya que suelen ser exclusivos del entorno en el que se ejecutan. Use not_if y only_if para proteger este recurso para la idempotencia.

trans-unit.source: Use the plist resource to set config values in plist files on macOS systems.
Use the portage_package resource to manage packages for the Gentoo platform.
trans-unit.target: Use el recurso portage_package para administrar paquetes para la plataforma Gentoo.

trans-unit.source: Use the powershell_package resource to install and manage packages via the PowerShell Package Manager for the Microsoft Windows platform. The powershell_package resource requires administrative access, and a source must be configured in the PowerShell Package Manager via the Register-PackageSource command or the powershell_package_source resource.

Use the powershell_package resource to install and manage packages via the PowerShell Package Manager for the Microsoft Windows platform. The powershell_package resource requires administrative access, and a source must be configured in the PowerShell Package Manager via the Register-PackageSource command or the powershell_package_source resource.
Use the powershell_package_source resource to register a PowerShell package repository.

Use the powershell_script resource to execute a script using the Windows PowerShell interpreter, much like how the script and script-based resources—bash, csh, perl, python, and ruby—are used. The powershell_script is specific to the Microsoft Windows platform and the Windows PowerShell interpreter.
trans-unit.target: Use el recurso powershell_script para ejecutar un script con el intérprete de Windows PowerShell, de forma muy parecida a cómo se utilizan los recursos basados ​​en script y script: bash , csh , perl , python y ruby . El powershell_script es específico para la plataforma Microsoft Windows y el intérprete de Windows PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: Use the powershell_script resource to execute a script using the Windows PowerShell interpreter, much like how the script and script-based resources bash, csh, perl, python, and ruby are used. The powershell_script is specific to the Microsoft Windows platform, but may use both the the Windows PowerShell interpreter or the PowerShell Core (pwsh) interpreter as of Chef Infra Client 16.6 and later.

Use the provision.rb recipe to build any infrastructure that is necessary to run an application. This recipe will discover all metadata.rb and/or metadata.json files that are located in the project’s root directory, plus any cookbook directories located under cookbooks/<project_cookbooks>.
Use the publish.rb recipe to make any artifact generated by this project available to other phases in the Chef Automate pipeline.

Use the python resource to execute scripts using the Python interpreter. This resource may also use any of the actions and properties that are available to the execute resource. Commands that are executed with this resource are (by their nature) not idempotent, as they are typically unique to the environment in which they are run. Use not_if and only_if to guard this resource for idempotence.
trans-unit.target: Use el recurso de Python para ejecutar scripts con el intérprete de Python. Este recurso también puede usar cualquiera de las acciones y propiedades que están disponibles para el recurso de ejecución . Los comandos que se ejecutan con este recurso no son (por su naturaleza) idempotentes, ya que suelen ser exclusivos del entorno en el que se ejecutan. Use not_if y only_if para proteger este recurso para la idempotencia.

trans-unit.source: Use the quality.rb recipe to run additional code quality and reporting tools.
Use the reboot resource to reboot a node, a necessary step with some installations on certain platforms. This resource is supported for use on the Microsoft Windows, Mac OS X, and Linux platforms.
trans-unit.target: Utilizar el reinicio de recursos para reiniciar un nodo, un paso necesario en algunas instalaciones en ciertas plataformas. Este recurso es compatible para su uso en las plataformas Microsoft Windows, Mac OS X y Linux.

trans-unit.source: Use the reboot resource to reboot a node, a necessary step with some installations on certain platforms. This resource is supported for use on the Microsoft Windows, macOS, and Linux platforms. In using this resource via notifications, it’s important to only use immediate notifications. Delayed notifications produce unintuitive and probably undesired results.
Use the registry_key resource to create and delete registry keys in Microsoft Windows.
trans-unit.target: Use el recurso Registry_key para crear y eliminar claves de registro en Microsoft Windows.

trans-unit.source: Use the remote_directory resource to incrementally transfer a directory from a cookbook to a node. The director that is copied from the cookbook should be located under COOKBOOK_NAME/files/default/REMOTE_DIRECTORY. The remote_directory resource will obey file specificity.

Use the remote_directory resource to incrementally transfer a directory from a cookbook to a node. The directory that is copied from the cookbook should be located under COOKBOOK_NAME/files/default/REMOTE_DIRECTORY. The remote_directory resource will obey file specificity.
trans-unit.target: Use el recurso remote_directory para transferir gradualmente un directorio de un libro de cocina a un nodo. El directorio que se copia del libro de cocina debe ubicarse en COOKBOOK_NAME/files/default/REMOTE_DIRECTORY . El recurso remote_directory obedecerá la especificidad del archivo.

trans-unit.source: Use the remote_file resource to transfer a file from a remote location using file specificity. This resource is similar to the file resource.
trans-unit.target: Use el recurso remote_file para transferir un archivo desde una ubicación remota utilizando la especificidad del archivo. Este recurso es similar al recurso de archivo .

trans-unit.source: Use the rescue_account resource to provide Administrators with a rescue account.

Use the rhsm_errata resource to install packages associated with a given Red Hat Subscription Manager Errata ID. This is helpful if packages to mitigate a single vulnerability must be installed on your hosts.

Use the rhsm_errata_level resource to install all packages of a specified errata level from the Red Hat Subscription Manager. For example, you can ensure that all packages associated with errata marked at a ‘Critical’ security level are installed.
Use the rhsm_register resource to register a node with the Red Hat Subscription Manager or a local Red Hat Satellite server.
Use the rhsm_repo resource to enable or disable Red Hat Subscription Manager repositories that are made available via attached subscriptions.

Use the rhsm_subscription resource to add or remove Red Hat Subscription Manager subscriptions from your host. This can be used when a host’s activation_key does not attach all necessary subscriptions to your host.
Use the route resource to manage the system routing table in a Linux environment.
trans-unit.target: Use el recurso de ruta para administrar la tabla de enrutamiento del sistema en un entorno Linux.

trans-unit.source: Use the rpm_package resource to manage packages for the RPM Package Manager platform.
trans-unit.target: Use el recurso rpm_package para administrar paquetes para la plataforma RPM Package Manager.

trans-unit.source: Use the rpm_package resource to manage packages using the RPM Package Manager.

Use the ruby resource to execute scripts using the Ruby interpreter. This resource may also use any of the actions and properties that are available to the execute resource. Commands that are executed with this resource are (by their nature) not idempotent, as they are typically unique to the environment in which they are run. Use not_if and only_if to guard this resource for idempotence.
trans-unit.target: Use el recurso ruby para ejecutar scripts usando el intérprete Ruby. Este recurso también puede usar cualquiera de las acciones y propiedades que están disponibles para el recurso de ejecución . Los comandos que se ejecutan con este recurso no son (por su naturaleza) idempotentes, ya que suelen ser exclusivos del entorno en el que se ejecutan. Use not_if y only_if para proteger este recurso para la idempotencia.

trans-unit.source: Use the ruby_block resource to execute Ruby code during a Chef Infra Client run. Ruby code in the ruby_block resource is evaluated with other resources during convergence, whereas Ruby code outside of a ruby_block resource is evaluated before other resources, as the recipe is compiled.

Use the ruby_block resource to execute Ruby code during a chef-client run. Ruby code in the ruby_block resource is evaluated with other resources during convergence, whereas Ruby code outside of a ruby_block resource is evaluated before other resources, as the recipe is compiled.
trans-unit.target: Use el recurso ruby_block para ejecutar el código Ruby durante una ejecución chef-cliente. El código Ruby en el recurso ruby_block se evalúa con otros recursos durante la convergencia, mientras que el código Ruby fuera de un recurso ruby_block se evalúa antes que otros recursos, a medida que se compila la receta.

trans-unit.source: Use the script resource to execute a script using a specific interpreter (Ruby, Python, Perl, csh, or Bash).
trans-unit.target: Use el recurso de secuencia de comandos para ejecutar una secuencia de comandos utilizando un intérprete específico (Ruby, Python, Perl, csh o Bash).

trans-unit.source: Use the script resource to execute scripts using a specified interpreter, such as Bash, csh, Perl, Python, or Ruby. This resource may also use any of the actions and properties that are available to the execute resource. Commands that are executed with this resource are (by their nature) not idempotent, as they are typically unique to the environment in which they are run. Use not_if and only_if to guard this resource for idempotence.
trans-unit.target: Use el recurso de secuencia de comandos para ejecutar secuencias de comandos utilizando un intérprete específico, como Bash, csh, Perl, Python o Ruby. Este recurso también puede usar cualquiera de las acciones y propiedades que están disponibles para el recurso de ejecución . Los comandos que se ejecutan con este recurso no son (por su naturaleza) idempotentes, ya que suelen ser exclusivos del entorno en el que se ejecutan. Use not_if y only_if para proteger este recurso para la idempotencia.

trans-unit.source: Use the security.rb recipe to execute security tests against a project’s source code.
Use the service resource to enable, and then start the service:
trans-unit.target: Use el recurso de servicio para habilitar y luego inicie el servicio:

trans-unit.source: Use the service resource to manage a service.
trans-unit.target: Use el recurso de servicio para administrar un servicio.

trans-unit.source: Use the service resource to restart and reload the Nginx service
trans-unit.target: Use el recurso de servicio para reiniciar y volver a cargar el servicio Nginx

trans-unit.source: Use the smartos_package resource to manage packages for the SmartOS platform.
trans-unit.target: Use el recurso smartos_package para administrar paquetes para la plataforma SmartOS.

trans-unit.source: Use the smoke.rb recipe to run smoke tests against deployed build artifacts to ensure they were deployed correctly and are minimally functional.
Use the snap_package resource to manage snap packages on Debian and Ubuntu platforms.
Use the solaris_package resource to manage packages on the Solaris platform.
Use the ssh_known_hosts_entry resource to add an entry for the specified host in /etc/ssh/ssh_known_hosts or a user’s known hosts file if specified.
Use the subversion resource to manage source control resources that exist in a Subversion repository.
trans-unit.target: Utilice el recurso de subversión para administrar los recursos de control de origen que existen en un repositorio de Subversion.

trans-unit.source: Use the sudo resource to add or remove individual sudo entries using sudoers.d files. Sudo version 1.7.2 or newer is required to use the sudo resource, as it relies on the #includedir directive introduced in version 1.7.2. This resource does not enforce installation of the required sudo version. Chef-supported releases of Ubuntu, SuSE, Debian, and RHEL (6+) all support this feature.
Use the swap_file resource to create or delete swap files on Linux systems, and optionally to manage the swappiness configuration for a host.
Use the syntax.rb recipe to verify that changes result in syntactically correct code. This process may involve compiling the code or running a validator for interpreted languages.

Use the sysctl resource to set or remove kernel parameters using the sysctl command line tool and configuration files in the system’s sysctl.d directory. Configuration files managed by this resource are named 99-chef-KEYNAME.conf.
Use the systemd_unit resource to create, manage, and run systemd units.
Use the template resource to configure httpd on the node based on the httpd.conf.erb template located in the cookbook:
trans-unit.target: Use el recurso de plantilla para configurar httpd en el nodo basado en la plantilla httpd.conf.erb ubicada en el libro de cocina:

trans-unit.source: Use the template resource to create an httpd.service on the node based on the httpd.service.erb template located in the cookbook:
trans-unit.target: Use el recurso de plantilla para crear un httpd.service en el nodo basado en la plantilla httpd.service.erb ubicada en el libro de cocina:

trans-unit.source: Use the template resource to manage the contents of a file using an Embedded Ruby (ERB) template by transferring files from a sub-directory of COOKBOOK_NAME/templates/ to a specified path located on a host that is running Chef Infra Client. This resource includes actions and properties from the file resource. Template files managed by the template resource follow the same file specificity rules as the remote_file and file resources.

Use the template resource to manage the contents of a file using an Embedded Ruby (ERB) template by transferring files from a sub-directory of COOKBOOK_NAME/templates/ to a specified path located on a host that is running the chef-client. This resource includes actions and properties from the file resource. Template files managed by the template resource follow the same file specificity rules as the remote_file and file resources.
trans-unit.target: Use el recurso de plantilla para administrar el contenido de un archivo utilizando una plantilla Embedded Ruby (ERB) mediante la transferencia de archivos desde un subdirectorio de COOKBOOK_NAME/templates/ a una ruta específica ubicada en un host que ejecuta el chef-cliente. Este recurso incluye acciones y propiedades del recurso de archivo . Los archivos de plantilla administrados por el recurso de plantilla siguen las mismas reglas de especificidad de archivo que el archivo remoto y los recursos de archivo .

trans-unit.source: Use the timezone resource to change the system timezone on Windows, Linux, and macOS hosts. Timezones are specified in tz database format, with a complete list of available TZ values for Linux and macOS here: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones. On Windows systems run tzutil /l for a complete list of valid timezones.
Use the unit.rb recipe to run unit tests for the project.
Use the user resource to add users, update existing users, remove users, and to lock/unlock user passwords.
trans-unit.target: Use el recurso de usuario para agregar usuarios, actualizar usuarios existentes, eliminar usuarios y bloquear / desbloquear contraseñas de usuario.

trans-unit.source: Use the user_ulimit resource to create individual ulimit files that are installed into the /etc/security/limits.d/ directory.
Use the windows_ad_join resource to join a Windows Active Directory domain.
Use the windows_admin_control resource to enforce Admin level access for system-wide changes.
Use the windows_app_management resource to configure nodes to use Gorilla for application management.
Use the windows_audit_policy resource to configure system level and per-user Windows advanced audit policy settings.
Use the windows_auto_run resource to set applications to run at login.
Use the windows_automatic_logout resource to set the system to automatically logout after a set time.

Use the windows_certificate resource to install a certificate into the Windows certificate store from a file. The resource grants read-only access to the private key for designated accounts. Due to current limitations in WinRM, installing certificates remotely may not work if the operation requires a user profile. Operations on the local machine store should still work.
Use the windows_defender resource to enable or disable the Microsoft Windows Defender service.
Use the windows_defender_exclusion resource to exclude paths, processes, or file types from Windows Defender realtime protection scanning.
Use the windows_desktop_screensaver resource to configure secure screensaver settings on Windows systems.
Use the windows_desktop_winrm_settings resource to setup and teardown WinRM settings on a node. Chef Infra Client does not require this for operation.
Use the windows_dfs_folder resource to creates a folder within DFS as many levels deep as required.
Use the windows_dfs_namespace resource to creates a share and DFS namespace on a Windows server.
Use the windows_dfs_server resource to set system-wide DFS settings.
Use the windows_disk_encryption resource to enable or disable BitLocker Drive Encryption on Windows systems.

Use the windows_env resource to manage environment keys in Microsoft Windows. After an environment key is set, Microsoft Windows must be restarted before the environment key will be available to the Task Scheduler.

Use the windows_feature resource to add, remove or entirely delete Windows features and roles. This resource calls the windows_feature_dism or windows_feature_powershell resources depending on the specified installation method, and defaults to DISM, which is available on both Workstation and Server editions of Windows.

Use the windows_feature resource to add, remove or entirely delete Windows features and roles. This resource calls the windows_feature_dism or windows_feature_powershell resources depending on the specified installation method, and defaults to DISM, which is available on both Workstation and Server editions of Windows.
Use the windows_feature_dism resource to add, remove, or entirely delete Windows features and roles using DISM.

Use the windows_feature_powershell resource to add, remove, or entirely delete Windows features and roles using PowerShell. This resource offers significant speed benefits over the windows_feature_dism resource, but requires installation of the Remote Server Administration Tools on non-server releases of Windows.

Use the windows_feature_powershell resource to add, remove, or entirely delete Windows features and roles using PowerShell. This resource offers significant speed benefits over the windows_feature_dism resource, but requires installation of the Remote Server Administration Tools on non-server releases of Windows.
Use the windows_firewall resource to enable or disable the Windows firewall service and all profiles.
Use the windows_firewall_profile resource to enable, disable, and configure the Windows firewall.
Use the windows_firewall_rule resource to create, change or remove Windows firewall rules.
Use the windows_font resource to install font files on Windows. By default, the font is sourced from the cookbook using the resource, but a URI source can be specified as well.
Use the windows_package resource to manage Microsoft Installer Package (MSI) packages for the Microsoft Windows platform.
trans-unit.target: Use el recurso windows_package para administrar los paquetes de Microsoft Installer Package (MSI) para la plataforma Microsoft Windows.

trans-unit.source: Use the windows_package resource to manage packages on the Microsoft Windows platform. The windows_package resource supports these installer formats:
Use the windows_pagefile resource to configure pagefile settings on Windows.
Use the windows_password_policy resource to setup password complexity, password length, etc.
Use the windows_path resource to manage the path environment variable on Microsoft Windows.
Use the windows_power_management resource to set the power settings of a kiosk-style device when you need it always-on
Use the windows_printer resource to setup Windows printers. Note that this doesn’t currently install a printer driver. You must already have the driver installed on the system.
Use the windows_printer_port resource to create and delete TCP/IPv4 printer ports on Windows.
Use the windows_security_policy resource to set a security policy on the Microsoft Windows platform.
Use the windows_service resource to create, delete, or manage a service on the Microsoft Windows platform.

Use the yum_package resource to install, upgrade, and remove packages with Yum for the Red Hat and CentOS platforms. The yum_package resource is able to resolve provides data for packages much like Yum can do when it is run from the command line. This allows a variety of options for installing packages, like minimum versions, virtual provides, and library names.

El recurso yum_package puede resolver provides datos para paquetes de manera muy similar a Yum cuando se ejecuta desde la línea de comandos. Esto permite una variedad de opciones para instalar paquetes, como versiones mínimas, ofertas virtuales y nombres de bibliotecas.

The yum_package resource is able to resolve provides data for packages much like Yum can do when it is run from the command line. Use the yum_repository resource to manage a Yum repository configuration file located at /etc/yum.repos.d/repositoryid.repo on the local machine. This configuration file specifies which repositories to reference, how to handle cached data, etc.

Use the `knife bootstrap` subcommand to run a bootstrap operation that installs Chef Infra Client on the target system. The bootstrap operation must specify the IP address or FQDN of the target system.

Use the `knife client` subcommand to manage an API client list and their associated RSA public key-pairs. This allows authentication requests to be made to the Chef Infra Server by any entity that uses the Chef Infra Server API, such as Chef Infra Client and knife.
Use the `knife configure` subcommand to create the [client.rb](/config_rb_client/) and [config.rb](/workstation/config_rb/) files so that they can be distributed to workstations and nodes.
Use the `knife cookbook` subcommand to interact with cookbooks that are located on the Chef Infra Server or the local chef-repo.
Use the `knife data bag` subcommand to manage arbitrary stores of globally available JSON data.

Use the `knife delete` subcommand to delete an object from a Chef Infra Server. This subcommand works similar to `knife cookbook delete`, `knife data bag delete`, `knife environment delete`, `knife node delete`, and `knife role delete`, but with a single verb (and a single action).
Use the `knife deps` subcommand to identify dependencies for a node, role, or cookbook.

Use the `knife diff` subcommand to compare the differences between files and directories on the Chef Infra Server and in the chef-repo. For example, to compare files on the Chef Infra Server prior to uploading or downloading files using the `knife download` and `knife upload` subcommands, or to ensure that certain files in multiple production environments are the same. This subcommand is similar to the `git diff` command that can be used to diff what is in the chef-repo with what is synced to a git repository.

Use the `knife download` subcommand to download roles, cookbooks, environments, nodes, and data bags from the Chef Infra Server to the current working directory. It can be used to back up data on the Chef Infra Server, inspect the state of one or more files, or to extract out-of-process changes users may have made to files on the Chef Infra Server, such as if a user made a change that bypassed version source control. This subcommand is often used in conjunction with `knife diff`, which can be used to see exactly what changes will be downloaded, and then `knife upload`, which does the opposite of `knife download`.

Use the `knife edit` subcommand to edit objects on the Chef Infra Server. This subcommand works similar to `knife cookbook edit`, `knife data bag edit`, `knife environment edit`, `knife node edit`, and `knife role edit`, but with a single verb (and a single action).
Use the `knife environment` subcommand to manage environments within a single organization on the Chef Infra Server.

Use the `knife exec` subcommand to execute Ruby scripts in the context of a fully configured Chef Infra Client. Use this subcommand to run scripts that will only access Chef Infra Server one time (or otherwise very infrequently) or any time that an operation does not warrant full usage of the knife subcommand library.

Use the `knife list` subcommand to view a list of objects on the Chef Infra Server. This subcommand works similar to `knife cookbook list`, `knife data bag list`, `knife environment list`, `knife node list`, and `knife role list`, but with a single verb (and a single action).
Use the `knife node` subcommand to manage the nodes that exist on a Chef Infra Server.
Use the `knife raw` subcommand to send a REST request to an endpoint in the Chef Infra Server API.

Use the `knife recipe list` subcommand to view all of the recipes that are on a Chef Infra Server. A regular expression can be used to limit the results to recipes that match a specific pattern. The regular expression must be within quotes and not be surrounded by forward slashes (/).
Use the `knife role` subcommand to manage the roles that are associated with one or more nodes on a Chef Infra Server.
Use the `knife search` subcommand to run a search query for information that is indexed on a Chef Infra Server.

Use the `knife serve` subcommand to run a persistent chef-zero against the local chef-repo. (chef-zero is a lightweight Chef Infra Server that runs in-memory on the local machine.) This is the same as running the Chef Infra Client executable with the `--local-mode` option. The `chef_repo_path` is located automatically and the Chef Infra Server will bind to the first available port between `8889` and `9999`. `knife serve` will print the URL for the local Chef Infra Server, so that it may be added to the config.rb file.

Use the `knife show` subcommand to view the details of one (or more) objects on the Chef Infra Server. This subcommand works similar to `knife cookbook show`, `knife data bag show`, `knife environment show`, `knife node show`, and `knife role show`, but with a single verb (and a single action).
Use the `knife ssh` subcommand to invoke SSH commands (in parallel) on a subset of nodes within an organization, based on the results of a [search query](/chef_search/) made to the Chef Infra Server.
Use the `knife ssl check` subcommand to verify the SSL configuration for the Chef Infra Server or a location specified by a URL or URI. Invalid certificates will not be used by OpenSSL.

Use the `knife ssl fetch` subcommand to copy SSL certificates from an HTTPS server to the `trusted_certs_dir` directory that is used by knife and Chef Infra Client to store trusted SSL certificates. When these certificates match the hostname of the remote server, running `knife ssl fetch` is the only step required to verify a remote server that is accessed by either knife or Chef Infra Client.
Use the `knife status` subcommand to display a brief summary of the nodes on a Chef Infra Server, including the time of the most recent successful Chef Infra Client run.
Use the `knife tag` subcommand to apply tags to nodes on a Chef Infra Server.
Use the `knife upload` subcommand to upload data to the Chef Infra Server from the current working directory in the chef-repo. The following types of data may be uploaded with this subcommand:
Use the `knife user` subcommand to manage the list of users and their associated RSA public key-pairs.
Use the `knife xargs` subcommand to take patterns from standard input, download as JSON, run a command against the downloaded JSON, and then upload any changes.
Use the authenticated https endpoint /status to monitor your Chef Automate installation.

trans-unit.source: Use to specify a group or user. The principal can be specified by either name or SID. When using a SID, you may use either the standard string representation of a SID (S-R-I-S-S) or one of the SDDL string constants. Chef Infra Client does not need to know if a principal is a user or a group.

Use to specify that search results only return objects to which an actor (user, client, etc.) has read access, as determined by ACL settings. This affects all searches. When true, the performance of the Chef management console may increase because it enables the Chef management console to skip redundant ACL checks. To ensure the Chef management console is configured properly, after this setting has been applied with a chef-server-ctl reconfigure run chef-manage-ctl reconfigure to ensure the Chef management console also picks up the setting. Default value: false.
trans-unit.target: Use para especificar que los resultados de búsqueda solo devuelven objetos a los que un actor (usuario, cliente, etc.) tiene acceso de lectura, según lo determinado por la configuración de ACL. Esto afecta a todas las búsquedas. Cuando es true , el rendimiento de la consola de administración de Chef puede aumentar porque permite que la consola de administración de Chef omita las verificaciones redundantes de ACL. Para garantizar que la consola de administración de Chef esté configurada correctamente, después de que esta configuración se haya aplicado con una chef-server-ctl reconfigure ejecute la reconfiguración chef-manage-ctl reconfigure para garantizar que la consola de administración de Chef también seleccione la configuración. Valor predeterminado: false .

trans-unit.source: User and Service Group Keys

User and service group keys also utilize asymmetric cryptography. To apply configuration changes to service groups when running in this mode, a user uses their own private key to encrypt configuration information for a service group, using that service group’s public key. The service group then uses its private key to decrypt the configuration information, and the user’s public key to verify.

User and service group keys are used to set up trust relationships between these two entities. Service groups can be set up to reject communication (e.g. applying new configuration via hab config apply) from untrusted users.
User assigned name for this resource. Must be unique within the project.
